title: ‘How do we know it Works’?
body:
## Old and New Problems with Measuring Impact (And how Web3 might solve them)

**Did ‘the good’ we tried to do, do any good? On the back of much criticism, this question drove not-for-profits, governments and institutions for much of the last half-century. Now, Crypto enters the scene, and along with regen, brings an explosion of DAO activity to the idea of funding public goods. So how can Web3 learn from the mistakes of the past, and measure impact effectively? Let’s find out.**

Charity, Aid, ‘doing good’ or now, ‘Impact’. Whatever we call organised altruism in [human societies](https://islamic-relief.org/news/zakat/#:\~:text=As%20one%20of%20the%20pillars,the%20remainder%20of%20their%20wealth.), it’s been core to our idea of community, for [thousands](http://www.globalgivingresource.com/blog/maat-inspired-giving-in-ancient-egypt/) of years.

It’s scaled to become industrial. Global philanthropy is valued at $2.1 trillion per annum (say [citibank](https://www.privatebank.citibank.com/newcpb-media/media/documents/insights/Philanthropy-and-global-economy.pdf)). Yet, Aid is beset: misuse of funds, accountability failure, and top-down decision-making, to name but a few. What we call *Impact*, seems ripe for disruption.

So what is it? Impact usually arrives where need meets altruism, in the form of NGOs and Community Based Organisations, who fill gaps where government provision falls short, or perhaps where human catastrophes or conflicts have happened.

Typical Impact administration models include government funded, private or philanthropic, and charitable foundations. Private sector giving, corporate social responsibility (CSR; which is funding or business activity, socially administered, yet aligned with business objectives) has become more common over recent years, whilst local groups are increasingly seen as the most sustainable delivery method, and tend to be the most responsive, due to their deeper levels of knowledge at community level.

Over the last 40 years Impact has changed dramatically. From the Bretton Woods System, to massive international charities, the Millennium Development Goals, [CSR](https://www.unido.org/our-focus/advancing-economic-competitiveness/competitive-trade-capacities-and-corporate-responsibility/corporate-social-responsibility-market-integration/what-csr#:\~:text=Corporate%20Social%20Responsibility%20is%20a,and%20interactions%20with%20their%20stakeholders.), [SDGs](https://sdgs.un.org/goals), and now [ESG](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-06/the-dawn-of-esg-is-decimating-ranks-of-new-petroleum-engineers). Money has shifted from cause to campaign, often aided by political trends: saviourism (inter-war years to 1950s), reconstruction and anti-communism (1945 to 1980s), famine in Africa (1980s), HIV/AIDS (1990s to early 2000s), to climate change prevention and adaptation (now).

Blockchain technology arrives as an obvious candidate to democratise the architecture that underlies global Impact. Powered by potential for hyper-local, transparent and frictionless governance, smart contracts offer the possibility of programmable funding for projects. Also, blockchains create means by which we can fairly price undervalued [public goods](https://schelling-joint.beehiiv.com/p/edition-1), meaning communities can be supported to do more good things for the planet, and companies can be incentivised to stop doing the opposite.

Yet any excitement around improvements to philanthropy’s substrate should not obscure Impact’s complexity. Improved tooling won’t guarantee improved outcomes, and some Web3 [projects know this](https://open.spotify.com/episode/3oaHIt3Myz9PpYO2y3oZmF?si=1b1f1025c22941ac), tapping into older expertise and seemingly unfashionable industry knowledge.

We as former/current Impact industry professionals (including one PhD in that field), and regenerative crypto economics enthusiasts, were drawn to these questions also. We wondered: what’s under represented here? One key challenge within the existing ecosystem of Impact we noticed, that blockchains will inherit, is ‘measurement’: how do we know what we’re doing is impactful?

We wanted to make a humble contribution to existing efforts  - such as those at [Gitcoin](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/proof-of-impact-proposals-wanted/10179) - to answer this question, by providing a brief synopsis of some of the continuing challenges that impact measurement faces in the Aid sector, and suggesting avenues for Web3 to build out from and create coordination mechanisms for. We hope any condensed value-added from our thoughts here, can be residual, or institutional memory, so that smarter Web3 folks building governance and funding systems communally in [regen](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/greenpill/id1609313639) may be better equipped, with these problems in mind.

In the first part we set the scene, look at DAOs, and some examples of their contributions to impact. We then introduce some of the historical failures of industrial impact, taking three levels of analysis (meta, macro and micro), examining one limited example from each (which we acknowledge is insufficient). Dividing into strata like this is problematic in Web3, as the ideal type of regenerative crypto-economics assumes the dissolution of these levels. Nonetheless, we include them so that the problems we identify in each level can be itemised contemporaneously. And in an attempt to move beyond taxonomies, at the end of each level, we suggest avenues for further solution-discovery for builders and community members in Web3 to work beyond types to forms of regen DeSoc, which distribute power more equitably in governance. Fortunately, as we can see in various thought-trajectories, there are already solutions that are being worked on that could be readily applied to these issues.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eJvYVmG30NSJAG1kbZEBK.png?height=60&width=1107)

## Part 1: How is Web3 approaching Impact?

**There are movements, such as [regen](https://greenpill.party/), which coalesce various societal communities within and beyond blockchains (such as [solarpunk](https://twitter.com/solarpunk_girl)) towards planetary regeneration and the feeding of public goods. There are also numerous DeFi and NFT projects that hive a portion of their profit off for good causes.**

However, in terms of function, when we think about Web3 and impact, we think about three tendencies that development seems to be leaning towards. These are: *coordination*, *funding*, and crucially, *proof*.

**1. Better Coordination: Impact DAOs**

Most people will know Web3 as cryptocurrencies, NFTs, and perhaps DeFi. But Web3’s first wave of democratisation towards governance came in the form of DAOs. A [DAO](https://consensys.net/blog/blockchain-explained/what-is-a-dao-and-how-do-they-work/) is an organisation without central authority. Instead the organisation is governed from the bottom-up by a decentralised body of users who make decisions on proposals. To propose and decide, in this model, is ideally [on-chain](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/onchain-governance.asp) but as a minimum publicly. The number of DAOs is exploding, a phenomenon we [explored](https://schelling-joint.beehiiv.com/p/edition-8-rokos-basilisk-dao-onslaught) earlier this year.

DAOs that focus on activities which were once the domain of Aid and philanthropy have been called  ‘Impact DAOs’; the [accepted definition](https://store.gitcoin.co/products/impactdao-book-digital-edition) being ‘a DAO that creates net positive externalities to the ecosystem around it’. Impact DAOs offer a Schelling point for those interested in a specific cause to pool efforts and resources in order to power a solution. Gold standard examples of Impact DAOs are: [Proof of Humanity](https://www.proofofhumanity.id/), [Celo](https://celo.org/) and [CoordinApe](https://coordinape.com/). [Gitcoin has published a book on Impact DAOs](https://store.gitcoin.co/products/impactdao-book-digital-edition); a great resource for further reading.

**2. Better Funding: Quadratic Funding**

Web3 technology provides an improved substrate for novel yet effective decision mechanics to have their moment. [Quadratic Funding](https://vitalik.ca/general/2019/12/07/quadratic.html), based upon [quadratic voting](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=2003531), is a method of matching-fund allocation that when [properly discounted](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4105763), rewards projects with the highest number of contributors, rather than those with the most contributed. The effect of this is greater plurality, and wider distribution of power, away from those with the deepest pockets. The current gold standard of QF in action is [Gitcoin Grants](https://gov.gitcoin.co/c/grants/15).

**3. Better Proof: Impact Certificates**

‘Doing good’ confers social status; it’s a major driver behind philanthropy, and sees its latest iteration in the now widely used concept of ‘[purpose](https://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/people-and-organizational-performance/our-insights/help-your-employees-find-purpose-or-watch-them-leave)’. Yet, an absentee has been proof that you have contributed to ‘doing good’. Web3 could allow for collections of  ‘Impact Certificates’ or proofs that someone contributed (either via contributing labor or finances) to Impact. These certificates would be owned by you, (some) non-transferrable, and displayed in wallets to denote history, or right to participate in other Impact activities. Some of these certificates could be NFTs, which creates the possibility of certificates being traded, leading to[ Impact Markets](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiDV56o5M7Q). A thriving marketplace for impact certificates (provable impact) would provide an improved incentive mechanism to fund more people to ‘do good’. Impact Certificates are in their infancy. However projects like [Funding the Commons](https://fundingthecommons.io/nov21/) are stress-testing them.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zjV-I0oaxDApMVGr5Vdz4.png?height=60&width=1107)

## Part 2: Old Problems and New Solutions?

**We’ve briefly introduced the history of Impact above, and looked at some of the tendencies Web3 seems to be building towards. The last - *proof -* is especially curious, because in its current iteration in Web3 projects, *proof* denotes whether a contributor has funded impact, but not whether the said impact was demonstrably and verifiably impactful. With this in mind, we sketch out three levels (meta, macro, micro) in which Industrial Aid has found challenges, and suggest one issue area within each level that we propose Web3 developers and community builders to keep in mind when creating.**

It’s important to note that the Impact Industry has soul-searched, analyzed its failings, and subjected itself to remarkable levels of self-criticism. At times, this has felt far more reflective than we would expect to see in public and private sectors. They have done a huge amount in a quest to be better, and continue to do so, to evolve. This has led to a number of measurement and process innovations within the last few decades, including:

* Emphasizing “hyper-local” funding solutions which flow direct to grassroots organisations.
* INGOs setting up local offices in the Global South, and being less top-down.
* Frameworks that capture complex social change processes, like [Theories of Change](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dpb4AGT684U&ab_channel=SocialInvestmentBusiness).
* Outcome-led funding allocation (funding released upon achievement of Impact Outcomes).
* Incorporating scientific methods - such as the Randomised Control Trial ([RCT](https://grassrootsoccer.org/2013/01/18/effectiveness-of-sport-based-hiv-prevention-interventions-a-systematic-review/)) - to understand cause and effect.
* Logical Frameworks (Logframes), to clearly link, and seperate, programme inputs, outputs, and outcomes.
* Increased [datarisation](https://www.efdn.org/blog/resource/16th-efdn-conference-efdn-upshot-presentation-new-efdn-%20mel-guide/) and validation, through investments in Monitoring & Evaluation, and using [data](https://vimeo.com/29684853) gathered to tell stories about interventions and how they worked.
* Open-source [toolkits](https://resourcecentre.savethechildren.net/collection/toolkit-monitoring-and-evaluating-childrens-participation/) for CBOs and NGOs to get started with data and analysis.

![Upshot, 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zK2jb1MFWW3XAA7QMA8Hq.png?height=1046&width=2012)

Yet despite this, we still inhabit a world in which the industry is set against the kind of derogatory statements that profiles like [Elon Musk](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-efforts-humanitarian-crises-and-their-status-2018-7?r=US&IR=T), [academics](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/46556936_Why_Foreign_Aid_Fails), and other [organisations](https://www.givewell.org/international/technical/criteria/impact/failure-stories#Ineffective_programs) regularly [make](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/46556936_Why_Foreign_Aid_Fails). The point is not that any of these critiques are correct; it is that they can persist. Or that the performance of the Impact Industry has not been enough to marginalise these voices.

So now we have understood something of the context for Impact, let’s zoom into some of these problem areas. Lets ask: why is it so hard to measure impact?

### PROBLEM 1 - META: POWER ASYMMETRIES

**At the Meta level, we are trying to understand problems as they relate to themselves. Another way of saying this is to say, we are looking at the fundamental level of the challenge, beyond  superficial characteristics, to the basic rules of the game.**

Historically, this has meant that ‘[meta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meta)’ might refer to the actual way power works in a system, even if most of the time that power is only obliquely visible. Impact measurement in the Aid industry has been mired in issues power distribution since the beginning of formal decolonisation, in the second half of the Twentieth Century, and its replacement with a neocolonial system of debt, aid, and dictats for neoliberal reform.

Back in 2017, one of us wrote a [book](https://www.taylorfrancis.com/chapters/edit/10.4324/9781315761930-37/sport-development-peace-alignment-administration-power-jacob-naish) chapter and a [thesis](https://cris.brighton.ac.uk/ws/portalfiles/portal/4758225/GOLDLEAF+FINAL+MIRRORED+to+print+and+bind+JNAISH.pdf) on one way in which power asymmetries manifest themselves in ‘development’ interventions (in that research, the kind of interventions that use sport). Although the work was specific to one type of ‘for good’ work by non-profits, the research drew from a 50+ year canon of Development Studies, Political Economy, and Sociology.

That corpus teaches us that attempts to ‘develop’ communities have power asymmetries baked in from the very beginning: aider/aidee, giver/receiver, funder/fundee, benefactor/beneficiary, knowledgeable/ignorant, advanced/backward, and so on. However, within preventative community-based programmes that worked on ‘behaviour change’ (e.g. addiction, reproductive health, employment, etc.) there were more specific, functionally weak power dynamics. These were based on biases in measurement, and definitional fluidity. Through a *[governmentality lens](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/228159866_Governmentality)*, these projects could be seen to rely on tenuous conceptual frameworks that sought to sustain these power asymmetries via rendering them ‘knowable’. They achieved this, tangentially, by artificially condensing a huge variety of human experience into microscopic instances where the non-profit spent time with the individuals they’re meant to serve. Another way of saying this is: non-profits sought to prove their impact by compacting social life, and all the complex factors that lead to a change in a community, and attributing those changes almost exclusively to their own work.

Whether that attribution was fair or not, was not the question. None of this suggests any malpractice at all. It’s just that to pull off this feat of justifying the funding that non-profits were receiving (itself a power asymmetry) the organisations had to condense a wide spectrum of possible causation into a few valuable moments that they shared with the beneficiaries, and codify this in impact measurement.

A myriad of software [platforms](https://impactinfocus.com/) sprung up around them to support. This helped these organisations turn all these loosely connected experiences into causation, which then got entered into databases, which then demonstrated impact, and sustained funding. Larger charities with greater economies of scale developed advantages in a competitive funding landscape throughout the early 2000s. Some organisations, especially smaller ones, became locked into a system of verification that they were not involved in the design of. As one participant from South Africa, heard at a European Development conference put it: “measure me on my own terms not the World Bank's”.

None of this discounts the fact that there are great organisations - in most cases - trying to grapple with difficult problems and creating a positive impact for the communities they serve. Yet unquestionably, they were mechanical in the sustenance of an unfair distribution of power, and the Aid industry has found this very difficult to reconcile, despite its best efforts.

**Web3 vs Impact Measurement at the Meta Level:**

Crypto has huge potential to democratise stakeholders and convert them into equity partners within a project. In so doing, they can create new, potentially fairer power dynamics. But Impact DAOs formed with the principles of regenerative cryptoeconomics have additional advantages to solve situations related to how power is distributed. First of all we can (through **POAPS, SBTs**, or other mechanisms to ensure participation is **‘bottom-up’**) democratise governance of impact funding. This answers a crucial question that Impact measurement has found it difficult to solve and take to scale: local ownership. Wedded to this ownership is [self sovereign](https://schelling-joint.beehiiv.com/p/past-future) control over one's identity (imagine refugees who own their [digital identity](https://books.google.dk/books?id=lfCBDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA244&lpg=PA244&dq=refugee+digital+birth+certificate+blockchain&source=bl&ots=cyzsh0DxM-&sig=ACfU3U2uRM95wUfdmoQoFNYOCg9I4kVShw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwi92rPLrPP4AhUIRPEDHTPFDvIQ6AF6BAgDEAM#v=onepage&q=refugee%20digital%20birth%20certificate%20blockchain&f=false) stored on blockchains, rather than on papers for example, and it’s up to them when, how and what to doxx). With this in mind, we can imagine a way in which a *participant* in an impact programme is at least equal with a contributor (or funder) by means of the protection of their digital identity with a wallet address on-chain. This also opens the door to markets in which elements of participants’ data can be shared without revealing anyone’s identity, for the purposes of monitoring and evaluation of programmes.

An additional measure to ensure diverse ownership **Quadratic Funding (QF), discounted to ensure plurality** - in the manner that [Ohlhaver, Weyl and Buterin](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4105763) suggest might work in Decentralised Society ([DeSoc](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4105763)) - is a means by which we can ensure the largest actors no longer hold the greatest sway in decision making.

***Avenues for further discovery or widened application at the meta level:***

* ***Plurality***
* ***Bottom Up approach***
* ***Self Sovereign identity***
* ***QF***
* ***SBTs/POAPs***

### PROBLEM 2 - MACRO: UNIT OF ANALYSIS

**It’s one thing to ask, ‘what worked?’ It’s quite another to ask the question ‘what do we measure, to understand if something worked or not?’ This is the Unit of Analysis problem; what to measure; what to pay for?**

Let’s imagine we’re trying to improve access to water in a community in Arizona. We have the building contractor working to bore the well. We have the government sanitation department who are tasked with regulating it, and the community who are likely to both use it, and maintain it. What do we measure, and thus pay for, if we want to know we are improving access to water? The awarding of the well contract, the boring of the hole, the completion of the project, or the community adopting it? What if we decide on any one of these, but no one actually ends up using the well (this [happened](https://www.theguardian.com/society/katineblog/2009/mar/26/water-projects-wasted-money), elsewhere btw, many times)?

Historically, what to measure (and where to lay fault when things don’t work out) has been a thorn in the side of attempts to demonstrate project efficacy. As such, some focus has shifted to measuring outcomes and sustainability long term, sometimes [ten years](https://www.theguardian.com/society/katineblog/2008/feb/25/waterdebatedoboreholeswork) after project inception, when community usage of the resource is shown to be viable long-term viable.

This is a point made by the [Brookings Institute](https://www.brookings.edu/opinions/measuring-aid-effectiveness-effectively-a-quality-of-official-development-assistance-index/) who say:

> *“Every aid agency faces this dilemma. They might do an evaluation at the project level to provide information on whether they are doing things right, but they have a great deal of difficulty knowing whether they are doing the right things to achieve the objectives they have set out for themselves. Absent that, aid agencies cannot learn and improve and for a long time most aid failures and successes were attributed to recipient countries, as if aid agency performance was a minor factor.”*

For too long, when the unit of analysis couldn’t be accurately pinpointed, local factors such as corruption were blamed, and not the project design. Measurement *of what* (and therefore *design* of *what),* in the quest to solve that problem became a real challenge.

**Web3 vs Impact Measurement at the Macro Level:**

The Unit of Analysis problem is a very real and likely inheritance which the funding of public goods via Web3 will need to solve for. It’s a problem you can see well understood by contributors in the first 19 minutes [here](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=1r52sIix66w). It’s also potentially immediate, in that it is a problem in the real-time cycle for impact, and yet developers and contributors should know that the solution from industrial Aid so far has been longer term evaluation cycles. Crypto effectively speeds up funding to projects, and investors could look for immediate proof of impact. If this is combined with a quest for scale, then we can see how this would provide problems for Impact DAOs and NGOs just looking to prove what they are doing really works long term (not necessarily for funding, but for the communities they serve). Long term **vesting** of incentives is one possible option to explore and iterate.

Retroactive funding ([discussed here](https://schelling-joint.beehiiv.com/p/edition-6-assholes-manifestos-trains)) of Impact provides a reliable incentive mechanism that, by design, encourages projects to concentrate on bringing long term value. For-profit organisations raise capital due to their promise of an exit. Retroactive funding creates the same possibility for a financial ‘exit’ for Impact organisations by paying for Impact already achieved. Web3 provides an improved substrate for this to operate on due to its programmable payments, with **oracles** speeding up and qualifying whether impact has happened, and if its time for an organisation to be paid. These solutions are in their infancy with [experimentation taking place](https://medium.com/ethereum-optimism/retropgf-experiment-1-1-million-dollars-for-public-goods-f7e455cbdca).

Also, perhaps a solution related to proximity can be worked towards (again, perhaps using **SBTs or POAPs**), which works on what might be called the **most proximate** community principle. This would ensure that those closest to the issue and most affected by it, decide what’s important to measure and pay for, and this remains on-chain.

Lastly, **transparent** terms and payments using smart contracts will allow questions of who did what, when, and to what end, to be more easily answered.

**Avenues for further discovery or widened application at the macro level:**

* ***Vesting***
* ***Retroactive funding***
* ***Oracles***
* ***Most proximate***
* ***SBTs/POAPs***

### PROBLEM 3 - MICRO: ATTRIBUTION

**Once something that we wanted happens, we then have the problem of knowing what caused it. This is the problem of *attribution.* Did the thing that we did result in the good stuff we wanted?**

When you begin with an intention, and a positive change happens shortly afterwards, it can be tempting to think you made it happen. ‘It’s too much of a coincidence for this not to be down to what we did, right?’.

Wrong, often, unfortunately. Causality is extremely difficult to prove, even in seemingly, the most nailed-on examples. This is why in medicine, researchers are cautious about attributing effects to causes. Instead, more commonly, ‘associations’ are made (‘where X happens we often see Y also happening). This is sketched out in [Bad Science](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3272165-bad-science) by Ben Goldacre, who uses the example of the relationship between smoking tobacco and lung cancer, to illustrate that despite the likelihood of cigarettes causing cancer being accepted since the 1940s, [the causal relationship](https://tobaccocontrol.bmj.com/content/21/2/87) between the two was not definitively (in part due to PR efforts by tobacco companies) established until the mid-1960s.

And the problem of attribution becomes even more punctuated in interventions designed for behaviour change. Socially, the problem of attribution is reducible to bias. The University of British Columbia [breaks this](https://opentextbc.ca/organizationalbehavioropenstax/chapter/attributions-interpreting-the-causes-of-behavior/) bias down into two forms in the context of organisational change and management:

> *“The first is called the fundamental attribution error. This error is a tendency to underestimate the effects of external or situational causes of behavior and to overestimate the effects of internal or personal causes. Hence, when a major problem occurs within a certain department, we tend to blame people rather than events or situations.*
>
> *The second error in attribution processes is generally called the self-serving bias. There is a tendency, not surprisingly, for individuals to attribute success on an event or project to their own actions while attributing failure to others. Hence, we often hear sales representatives saying, “I made the sale,” but “They stole the sale from me” rather than “I lost it.” These two biases in interpreting how we see the events around us help us understand why employees looking at the same event often see substantially different things.”*

Any social intervention can be said to be vulnerable to these biases, and aid is no exception. To return to our earlier example, access to water resources, even in dry areas, can help prove the point. Wells have been successfully bored in desertified water-scarce areas, and new water sources tapped. At this stage, you’d be forgiven for thinking: job done. But in some cases, due to [a variety](https://www.theguardian.com/society/katineblog/2009/mar/26/water-projects-wasted-money) of subjective forces (including a lack of local ownership and little consultation with communities) within a few months, wells go unused. The issue is that in design, the project biases towards completion of the well (accessing the water). What is under estimated yet critically important, is its sustainable use long term.

The attribution issue doesn't stop at bias. Any given intervention is surrounded by other constantly changing factors, like culture, economics, environment, and politics. These fluid elements can create conditions whereby the impacts of programmes designed to ‘support’ development become [imperceptible](https://www.brookings.edu/opinions/measuring-aid-effectiveness-effectively-a-quality-of-official-development-assistance-index/). Contemporary degrees of connectedness and  macroeconomic interdependence, obscure the effect of local interventions. Price changes for example, can suddenly change due to macro conditions, and as they do, define the success or failure of a programme (take micro loans for entrepreneurship, for example). meaning that, at best, we get a camouflaging of any measurable impacts, and at worst, these glocal forces outweigh any benefits or costs.

To navigate these difficulties, some projects have relied upon subjective storytelling which, though rich and important for demonstrating change, can also be problematic. Human experience can at times feel like it’s being reduced to content-friendly marketing material, and projects risk creating the impression that stories are captured to satisfy funders.

For Impact DAOs, the challenge to overcome is to ensure we are incentivising outcomes that weren’t on their way anyway. If a community plants mangroves, and these sequester more carbon, has the planting happened because of an incentive from a DAO, or is it because of a resurgence in particular forms of community knowledge, or a governmental awareness campaign, or all?

One potential answer is it doesn’t matter. If we are funding outcomes that are going to happen anyway, at worst we may only be risking the likelihood of those outcomes happening elsewhere; even perhaps sustaining the positive outcome for longer. In the frame of this response, the outcome is the most important thing, not the intention, nor even the object of the funding. But if we are to evaluate what we did, and if it worked, we won’t know with any certainty unless we can attribute effect to cause. And this may problematise the accuracy of funding in the future, and risk higher opportunity costs.

Here’s some suggestions, based on this micro-problem of attribution, for how Web3 can approach these issues in the future.

**Web3 vs Impact Measurement at the Micro Level:**

Impact DAOs can work on the problem of attribution by involving local **stakeholders** in project governance at the outset. It’s a longstanding critique of the Aid industry, that they were too slow to let local stakeholders lead over the years. Creating mechanics whereby communities most affected by challenges can set project terms would be wise. Then, verifying the plurality of that group (perhaps **via POAP or SBTs**) and empowering them through governance mechanics to shape the definition of the public good the project is designed to feed, would be welcome for many Impact DAOs, especially when weighed against the history of the Aid industry.

**Avenues for further discovery or widened application at the micro level:**

* ***Stakeholder approach***
* ***Plurality***
* ***SBTs/POAPs***

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pyMzS16rUgttwWsfvGOt1.png?height=60&width=1107)

### CONCLUSION

Our intention here was to condense some knowledge from the older Impact space - what we have variously called the ‘Impact’, ‘Aid’, ‘philanthropy’, or ‘doing good’ industries - in the form of problem statements for impact measurement over recent years. It’s by no means substantive, or complete. Merely an aperture to 3 different problem areas at three different levels, which may provoke other discussion to improve Impact DAO effectiveness in the future. We hope though that there is some value-add in the building of regen’s institutional memory, so that smarter Web3 folks can communicate and build with these problems in mind. Our humble summary of some of the problems of the past, for the tech on the horizon to build in cognisance of.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oulncAFylxmmlv27CV8-s.png?height=1440&width=2880)

*A shorter version of this article appears in our newsletter, [The Schelling Joint](https://schelling-joint.beehiiv.com/)
We want to say a big Thank You to [Preeti Shetty](https://twitter.com/PreetiSporty), CEO of [UPSHOT](https://twitter.com/UpshotSystem) and an Impact specialist, who gave input and guidance in the formation of this article.*

body:
# 合并

**Sepolia 合并回顾**

在第 142 次以太坊核心开发者会议上，开发者们对 Sepolia 合并进行了回顾，在合并后看到了大量验证者因为与 TTD 相关的配置问题而掉线。

简单来说，出现这个问题是因为有些运行者不小心做了两次 TTD 覆盖，尽管他们实际上运行的是正确的合并客户端。出于以下几个原因，这种情况我们预计在主网上不会看到的。

首先，理想情况下，我们在主网上完全不需要使用 TTD 覆盖！用户要么下载一个单一客户端版本 (如果我们从一开始就设置了真正的 TTD)，要么下载两个客版本，一个人为设置了高 TTD，一个设置了真正的 TTD。

而 Sepolia 的情况是，有些运行者改为运行 TTD 覆盖以设置非常大的 TTD，然后下载具有正确 TTD 的客户端版本，但运行带有 TTD 覆盖 flag 的版本，这将其设置回错误的值。

也就是说，主网上不存在我们会使用 TTD 覆盖来设置一个“错误”或“临时" TTD 的情况，起码不会是默认选项 (显然，人们还是可以运行自定义的配置而导致出错的！)。

但实际上，运行主网合并软件版本才是正常做法，而不是在以前的版本上运行特殊配置。如果真的要在主网上使用 TTD 覆盖，它将总是从一个”错误“/”临时“ TTD 变成真正的 TTD。

这可能在 PoW 测试网上发生的原因是算力太低，以至于有人让合并发生得太快的成本是很小的。因此，我们必须设置一个真的非常高的 TTD，并在信标链准备合并的时候手动调低它。

因此，Sepolia 上我们的最大问题基本上是配置问题，这不是我们计划在主网上会遇到的情况。总的来说，Sepolia 合并非常令人鼓舞！

此外，还有两个小问题：首先，出现了一个由无效签名的区块在网络上广播。尽管这不影响链的共识，开发者仍然尽力调查根本原因。第二，Besu 遇到一个与数据库相关的问题，导致有些节点必须重新同步。修复在他们的最新版本里实现了：<https://t.co/hl8KO73NIe>

来源：

[https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545473584511852546?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw](https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545473584511852546?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw)

`LastValidHash` 问题的进展

开发者 Potuz 提出了一个 PR，大概意思是，CL 客户端使用 `LastValidHash` (LVH) 作为从它们的数据库修剪整个非权威分叉的一种方式。要实现这点，他们假设一个 LVH 的任何子区块都是无效的。也就是说，会有临界情况是这些假设不成立的。

例如，如果执行层收到一个任意无效区块，它会知道这个区块是无效的，但它不能指向一个 LVH，因为它并不知道它在哪一点上偏离了权威链。

这个 PR 使得客户端之后响应“null"，这样 CL 客户端就可以知道他们可能只修剪一个无效区块，而不是从创世后的链。

开发者们将确保添加多个测试来找到各种临界情况，并确保客户端在所有情况下都正确响应！

来源：

[https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545478478266392577?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw](https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545478478266392577?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw)

**Goerli 合并前各客户端需要完成的工作**

由于 Goerli 测试网是最后一个合并的测试网，并且其社区最大，由最活跃的信标链，开发者们想要客户端版本能尽可能接近于功能完备。EL 团队需要添加 LVH 支持，但这是一个很小的添加工作。

Erigon 说他们想要做更多的同步测试，特别在 EL 与 CL 检查点同步方面。Nethermind 说他们有一些漏洞要修复，还要看看 hive 测试。Besu 还剩下一个 hive 测试了，还有一些非合并相关的问题。

在 CL 方面，客户端的主要问题是新增的对 mev-boost 的测试。

开发者们感觉可以在这周的共识层会议上或下周的 ACD 上选 Goerli 测试网合并的 TTD。当然，这是假设事情都进行顺利。这周会有一个影子分叉，这次会尝试测试 mev-boost！

来源：

[https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545480593286148098?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw](https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545480593286148098?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw)

**Goerli 合并关键事件节点安排讨论**

在 142 次以太坊核心开发者会议上，开发者们讨论了如何安排 Goerli 测试网的 Bellatrix/Paris/TTD 客户端发布，并都同意这次的流程应该与主网的流程一致。就此展开了有趣的安全性/哲学对话。

根据合并的设计，这个流程应该是在信标链激活 Bellatrix 分叉，信标链开始监听 TTD，TTD 被触达。因此，开发者们希望发生的顺序是：客户端发布->Bellatrix epoch->触达TTD 。

由于 Rospten 有人突然大幅提高算力的情况不会在主网发生，而且 PoW 区块链通常假设攻击者不会控制 51% 的算力，这是一个“安全的”假设，但也需要审慎。开发者们还需要在用户体验和安全性的考虑上再深入思考。

来源：

[https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545481518461566976?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw](https://twitter.com/TimBeiko/status/1545481518461566976?s=20&t=N2G8SNNDnDE5oeAK84cmLw)

其他主网更新，请看最新一期《[以太坊核心开发者会议更新](https://www.ethereum.cn/Eth2/allcoredevs-updates012)》

# Layer2

**Arbitrum 推出基于 AnyTrust 技术的方案 Arbitrum Nova**

7 月 12 日，L2 扩容解决方案 Arbitrum 宣布推出 AnyTrust 技术 (链下数据可用性) 的链 Arbitrum Nova。Arbitrum Nova 与 Arbitrum One 平行运行，前者基于 AnyTrust 技术，后者基于 optimistic rollup 技术。两者的主要区别是：Arbitrum One 将所有交易数据存储在以太坊上，而 Nova 利用数据可用性委员会将数据存储在链下。

关于 AnyTrust 技术的细节，可以看[《以太七日谈 • 2022/3/9》](https://www.ethereum.cn/Ecosystem/eth-weekly-2022-3-9/)这期七日谈。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MLbwFeR06UNg_5F8zhq50.png?height=755&width=872)

目前 Arbitrum Nova 的主网已面向开发者开放，将在未来几周面向用户开放。

Nova 与 EVM 完全兼容，开发者可以在此填写表格申请访问 Nova 主网：<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScuVz5UNpmonn8j2tam9py0PItrXEZKE85iHNE0KHgbxZbeKg/viewform>

文档：<https://github.com/OffchainLabs/nitro/blob/master/docs/inside_anytrust.md>

浏览器：<https://a4ba-explorer.arbitrum.io/>

来源：

[https://twitter.com/arbitrum/status/1546560661282586626](https://twitter.com/arbitrum/status/1546560661282586626)

**OpenZeppelin 发布 Cairo 合约 0.2.0 版本**

7 月 5 日，智能合约开发平台 OpenZeppelin 发布 Cairo 合约 0.2.0 版本。此前，OpenZeppelin 发布了 Cairo v0.1.0 的合约，开发者可以利用使用 Cairo 语言编写的标准智能合约在 StarkNet 上构建自己的应用。

新版本的变化包括可扩展性的改进、新账户(以太坊兼容的账户合约)、访问权限 (AccessControl) 以及重入防御(reentrancy guard) 等。

来源：<https://blog.openzeppelin.com/announcing-openzeppelin-contracts-for-cairo-v0-2-0/>

**DeFi 隐私桥接方案 Aztec Connect 上线主网**

此前，2021 年 3 月 16 日，以太坊 L2 zk-rollup 隐私扩容解决方案 Aztec 2.0 上线主网，推出基于密码学技术 PLONK 的 L2 隐私支付项目 zk.money。用户可以通过 zk.money 隐私地发送和接收代币。

Aztec Connect 是以太坊上的 DeFi 隐私桥接方案，利用 Aztec Connect，用户可以桥接隐私资产至主网以进行 DeFi 交互，并在同一笔交易中返回到 Aztec 中。这使用户能够便宜且隐私地与任意以太坊 DeFi 应用交互。

7 月 7 日，Aztec Connect 正式上线主网。Aztec 基于 Plonk (一种生产级别标准的 zk-SNARK) 实现隐私扩容方案。

Aztec Connect 的发布意味着 DeFi 迎来了新的范式：

* 隐私 DeFi：质押、借贷和 swap 等功能都可以通过隐私的方式实现
* Gas 费大大降低
* 对于金库管理、链上 DAO 治理以及 NFT 购买与交易的隐私实现方式

Aztec 还重新发布了 zk.money 以用于隐私 DeFi 聚合器，此前仅作为隐私支付方案。用户可以访问 zk.money 通过主网 Curve 购买 Lido 的 stETH，或者在 Element Finance 质押。

Aztec Connect SDK：<https://github.com/AztecProtocol/sdk-starter-kit>

文档：<https://docs.aztec.network/>

来源：

[https://twitter.com/aztecnetwork/status/1545046832597700611](https://twitter.com/aztecnetwork/status/1545046832597700611)

**StarkNet 计划在 2022  年的第四季度启动 “最终状态重置”**

7 月 7 日，L2 扩容解决方案 StarkNet 宣布他们的 “最终状态重置” (Final State Reset, FSR) 计划。为了让 StarkNet 更加精简、安全，StarkNet 决定通过 FSR 移除操作系统和协议内的冗余代码和流程。

目前的 StarkNet Alpha 版本会保持运行，未来将推出并行运行的精简版 StarkNet Alpha。现在需要所有帐户和合约迁移至新网络。

来源：<https://medium.com/starkware/regenesis-starknets-no-sweat-state-reset-e296b12b80ae>

**Polygon Hermez 的 zkEVM 即将推出测试网**

Polygon 负责人 @khanhamzah 透露 Polygon 旗下的 zkRollup 项目 Polygon Hermez 正在开发的 zkEVM 即将推出测试网：

[https://twitter.com/khanhamzah/status/1544734783850299394](https://twitter.com/khanhamzah/status/1544734783850299394)

**Connext 推迟其代币 Next 的发布**

L2 跨链协议 Connext 透露由于最近市场的状况和波动性，决定暂时推迟其代币发布计划。

Connext 表示，在这短暂的延迟期间，核心贡献者将优先考虑其工程和社区工作，为即将推出的 Amarok 做准备，这是 Connext 网络的一个重大升级，将允许开发者构建信任最小化的跨链应用程序。

来源：

[https://twitter.com/ConnextNetwork/status/1546605434747981829](https://twitter.com/ConnextNetwork/status/1546605434747981829)

# 生态

**Aave 正在向 AaveDAO 提议新的超额抵押型稳定币 GHO**

7 月 7 日，DeFi 平台 Aave 创建了一个新稳定币 GHO 的 ARC (Aave request for comment)，正在向它的 AaveDAO 提议采用新的加密货币超额抵押型稳定币 GHO。GHO 是一种多种资产抵押代币，支持任何 Aave 协议可用的加密货币作为抵押，与美元 1:1 挂钩。

用户抵押加密货币到其协议中以铸造 GHO，当用户偿还借出的 GHO 后，协议会返还抵押品并销毁用户的 GHO。GHO 的所有利息支付款将直接转移到 AaveDAO 金库。

title: Technical Analysis - BTC, ETH, SOL
body:
*The following views are my own and do not constitute financial advice, nor an offering to invest in Buckman Capital or any other entity mentioned throughout this article.*

Gm all, today we will be doing some technical analysis on large cap cryptocurrencies. I personally do not get too caught up in technical analysis as I believe most market moves are based purely on fundamentals, but I do believe TA can help with entry / exit points for a position. Today we will be looking at 3 different cryptocurrencies, as listed in the title. This will be a rotating list of coins and may increase in size if I get some requests.

Before we talk about price action, it may be important to explain some of the indicators I am using on my charts. Please note, I removed support and resistance lines as it would make the chart very messy for reading. Starting at the very bottom, though, is the RSI which stands for Relative Strength Index. Many classify the RSI as a momentum indicator, meaning it can measure the magnitude of recent price action in relation to past price action and whether or not the asset is oversold or overbought. Just above the RSI is a volume indicator. This indicator portrays the amount of buys and sells that have occurred in a specified time period. 

Above that, you will see a series of white lines (and a red/green one), this is an indicator that I rarely see anybody using. The indicator with a series of white lines is a universal logarithmic growth curve. Logarithmic analysis is a statistical approach that uses historical data to forecast and predict future prices. In this case, the logarithmic growth curve takes all the historical price data of the asset and uses logarithmic growth analysis to develop curves that project a potential path of future price growth. It isn’t the prettiest, but if you use a little imagination you can get the idea.

Lastly, you will see another series of thicker, colorful lines. The yellow, purple, and orange lines are called Simple Moving Averages. A Simple Moving Average (SMA) calculates the average of a selected range of prices, usually closing prices, by the number of periods in that range. The ranges I have on my charts are as follows, 13, 34, 280, however most traders will use some variation of 5, 10, 50, or 200.


---

![BTC 1W (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/v6uIErhKFlpX_3nExvpZt.png?height=1226&width=1615)

Now that you understand what each indicator is, let’s finally take a look at some cryptocurrencies. First up, BTC. Above is the weekly BTC chart (meaning our time period is 1 week), using Kraken exchange as the source of our data. There are a couple of interesting stories this chart tells us, first looking at the RSI. Since *2014* Bitcoin has never been this oversold on Kraken. In other words, Bitcoin has not been consistently sold as much as it is currently in relation to selloffs seen on Kraken since 2014. I also think it is interesting how the BTC price hit the 280 SMA perfectly after the COVID crash in March of 2020, and how we are now sitting on that 280 SMA once again in the depths of a crypto bear market.

![BTC 1D (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FHVpIwLyp4NucduwJ4rmY.png?height=1151&width=1616)

Zooming in a bit to the daily BTC chart, we see a higher frequency picture in terms of RSI, Volume, and price action in general. One interesting point here is the 34 SMA. Notice how BTC seems to keep testing the 34 SMA, and getting instantly rejected and sent lower? You will also notice that we are neither overbought or oversold on the RSI, which has been the case with each of the two most recent tests of the 34 SMA. We will stop there for BTC, but as you can see there are a couple of interesting takeaways we can establish by simply looking at a chart, and recognizing trends that are not necessarily just in the candles themselves.


---

![ETH 1W (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/b4NmY6MDhjEtP1wl_xVH8.png?height=1226&width=1616)

Moving onto our second cryptocurrency: ETH. All of our indicators have the same inputs as the BTC chart, they are just essentially copied onto the ETH chart here. Notice any similarities to the BTC chart? We are once again the lowest on the RSI (or pretty close to being the lowest) in the history of ETH trading on Kraken. We are also sitting pretty on top of that 280 SMA, as well as one of the logarithmic growth curve levels. This is quite common across *all* cryptocurrencies, as most of the market follows BTC, and then ETH. Keep in mind, too, that each candle on the chart represents 1 week of price action. As you can see over the past 3-4 weeks, ETH and BTC have both been ranging in a pretty tight range while volume has been decreasing slightly.

![ETH 1D (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QHi-SSKHljdw2LGTgz-FA.png?height=1226&width=1616)

Getting to the daily ETH chart, it looks like we are seeing price action similar to BTC in regards to the SMAs. There is one small difference, however, with the logarithmic growth curve, which shows ETH hitting the relative upper bound twice, as well as being rejected from the 34 SMA. With BTC, the price hit the relative lower bound twice, with price being rejected from the 34 SMA. Nothing super crazy to note in terms of volume.


---

![SOL 1W (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KFz7Wpl3iwpL0_MMzNRX8.png?height=1151&width=1615)

Last but not least, let’s take a look at SOL. Some may not classify Solana as a blue chip due to its inability to maintain 100% network uptime, but I have used Solana regularly and believe it has all of the necessary components to be a blue chip and maintain its status over the coming years. From the chart, we can see it looks much different than the BTC and ETH charts. One explanation for this could be due to the fact Solana markets are much less liquid, meaning it takes significantly less capital to move SOL price than it does to move BTC or ETH. The RSI is pretty low, but not the lowest it has been in the past. Our logarithmic growth curve looks much different, but it looks like it has caught some moves perfectly like in March of 2022, and multiple times towards the top where Solana traded around $250. We can also see how perfectly the price has touched those 13 and 24 SMA’s in the past, and how far below them we are now.

![SOL 1D (KRAKEN) - July 12, 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E35xn2CG1MOZmZ04pdySA.png?height=1226&width=1616)

Looking at the daily SOL chart, the first takeaway I have is the RSI. In the weekly chart it looked like we were approaching a level that would indicate the asset being significantly oversold, however we now see that on the daily chart, that is not the case. Another takeaway I have is watching the 13 SMA (from a few days into May until about halfway through June), notice how many times on the way down the price gets rejected. We finally broke above the 13 SMA *and* the 34 SMA, but then were rejected by the lower bound of the logarithmic growth curve. We ran it back and cleared the 13 and 34 SMAs again but were once again rejected by that lower bound of the logartihmic growth curve. It will be an interesting day if and when SOL breaches that lower bound of the log curve which sits at around $40.


---

body:
**宗旨：All in Crypto. Hunting the darkhorses of the Crypto world.**

**推特：**

[https://twitter.com/DarkHorse_BTC](https://twitter.com/DarkHorse_BTC)

# 概要：

* 养成资产存钱包的习惯，大额放冷钱包硬件钱包，不要绝对的信任任何中心化机构，包括BN。近30天消失了25家加密交易所，而BTC遭受的历次重大攻击都源于中心化机构。
* 市场缩量小幅波动，无明显多空方向，都在等待周三晚公布的6月CPI数据，目前CME显示7月27日加息75BP概率93%，如果CPI在预期范围附近则对市场没有更大冲击。
* 本周地缘政治情势突变，OPEC秘书长巴尔金多突然被逝世，英国首相鲍尔斯被逼辞职，日本前首相政治实权BOSS安培晋三遇刺身亡，北约启动芬兰瑞典入盟，斯里兰卡破产陷入动乱，立陶宛阻止俄国向飞地加里宁格勒运送货物，背后主线逻辑是美国民主党政府不择手段吸血全球，缓和国内矛盾。
* 下周拜登将访沙特估计会进一步施压石油增产，打压油价，并可能进一步施压日欧元贬值加速资产回流美国。关注油价和日欧元走势，若三者下跌有利于美国缓和自身危机，降低加息压力，也降低了经济衰退的可能。为了配合打压日欧可能还会加息保持美元强势直至完成阶段吸血目标。
* 币市各指标无明显变化，交易所BTC加速流出，以小额和巨鲸囤币为主，量变积累终究形成质变。

# 0、本周市场重大事件

### 宏观经济与政策

* 美国非农就业数据超预期，失业率符合预期，降低了对经济衰退的担忧，继续维持之前加息力度，周三晚上公布CPI数据，关系后续加息力度。据11日CME美联储观察数据，7月加息75BP概率93%，若最终加息50BP算是利好。
* 本周地缘政治情势突变，OPEC秘书长巴尔金多突然被逝世，英国首相鲍尔斯被逼辞职，日本前首相政治实权BOSS安培晋三遇刺身亡，北约启动芬兰瑞典入盟，斯里兰卡破产陷入动乱，立陶宛阻止俄国向飞地加里宁格勒运送货物，这些一连串事件的背后逻辑很清晰，美国民主党政府不惜一切手段逼迫对手和盟友完全配合其政策，吸血全球，缓解其自身危机，在利用战争地缘危机打击中俄不成功的情况下，打击日欧，驱赶日欧资本回流美国，并施压沙特为首的OPEC增产石油，降低通胀并打击俄国，下周拜登将访问沙特，看俄国能否帮助沙特支撑住压力，是否会大幅增产有效打击油价？
* 本周美元指数暴涨，日元和欧元今年已贬值20%，欧元区核心德法都出现贸易逆差，这是极为罕见的。随着安培被杀，欧洲领导人被爆丑闻，市场担忧的日欧经济衰退恐怕会加剧，为了进一步吸血日欧，美元恐怕还会继续加息维持美元指数强势。
* 本周原油大跌后被收回大半，美国成品油本周大跌；上半年美国抵押贷款利率从3.1%涨到5.8%，现回落到5.3%，似乎见顶了。美商务部长表示，拜登很快取消对华进口商品部分关税，主要为日用品领域，这些都有利于缓解通胀压力。
* 但本周铜大跌，预示市场对衰退的担忧；IMF总裁表示不排除明年出现全球性衰退的可能；7月8日，美国亚特兰大联储公布其GDP跟踪器显示的最新结果，2022年第二季度，美国的实际GDP增长为-1.2%。
* 华尔街日报抨击SEC对现货比特币ETF双标，SEC成员Hester Peirce认同。华尔街再发文质疑，欧洲有70支ETF，而SEC为何还反对？
* 欧盟议会要求法国解释批准币安注册的合理性。俄证券交易所可能创建自己的加密货币交易所。韩国推出加密货币银行。土耳其通胀78%，比特币交易量大增40%。
* 世界的动荡，客观上会加速去中心化货币BTC的推广使用。

### 传统资本

* 洛克菲勒国际主管表示，比特币的回归，将像1990年代的亚马逊一样，对美元的依赖不能再继续了。世界级大金主的发言，意味深厚。
* MakerDAO通过MIP6 提案，允许美国亨廷顿谷银行抵押链下贷款借出DAI，链上金融与传统金融的融合发展。
* 摩根大通三名高管转入加密行业。比特币反对者Peter Schiff表示愿意接受比特币。一直抨击比特币的巴菲特，其公司向三箭发放的60亿无抵押贷款全亏，太搞笑了。
* 富达全球策略主管表示，比特币价格表现处于2013年以来的最低水平，比特币遵循互联网采用曲线，未来将经历温和上涨。
* 马斯克放弃收购推特。

### Crypto新闻事件

* 美国加密货币经纪商Voyager破产申请，有超过10万名散户托管BTC，其中3AC欠债6.5亿，SBF的Alameda欠债3.7亿，市场推测3AC和SBF等在下跌时从其借BTC砸盘市场获利。
* Celsius偿还3440万DAI，将BTC清算价降到2722美元，危机解除。
* BN免除多个BTC稳定币交易对手续费，有人认为是市场营销行为，有人认为是BTC亏空，吸引用户充值BTC。
* CZ嘲笑SBF欠Voyager3.7亿美元，到其破产都没归还，SBF回应对方无法偿还抵押物，两个终极大BOSS终于也怼架了，熊市特征之一。
* 孙宇晨表示愿意花费高达 50 亿美元来帮助陷入困境的加密公司，他认为市场行情中“最坏的情况”已经过去。
* Kucoin表示2022年上半年新增975万注册用户，同比增219%，其中亚洲560万。
* 近30天消失了25家加密交易所，多少散户财产丢失。
* CB的比特币溢价正在恢复，表明美国的机构和散户开始主动买入。
* 近30天，5.9万BTC从CEX流入私人钱包，10\~100枚比特币地址过去5周增持5.2万枚。达到429万。
* 微策略CEO表示，2020年入场以来，比特币涨83%，加密货币依然在上升期，长期跑赢传统资产。

title: Cropped, caged, conjured
body:
![Midjourney: liquid epoch, not square, Photoshop: Quick Selection, Topaz Studio: AI Remix](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JoEJsBDZzvTBYjaM6kcOR.png?height=1619&width=2000&size=medium)

## Time to reshape the image

Images reproduced in print and on screens are mediated images. Long ago, the domain of the mediated image witnessed an elemental format war from which the *rectangular* emerged victorious. *Images. Are. Rectangular.* Every contemporary imaging medium is optimised-up-to-the-eyeballs for the rectangular. Yes, despite the fundamental *circularity* of the lenses attached to practically every camera and optical imaging device in pictorial history, their conical light has traditionally been projected onto *rectangular* canvas, *rectangular* film, and *rectangular* digital sensor. All light that exceeds these rectangular bounds was lost to an invisible void.

How did the rectangle come to command such monolithic authority? What forces will reshape mediated images in a post-lens, text-to-image and *image*-to-image era in which even the circular has been rendered obsolete? Here I share six high-level historical conceptions of the image edge and call on graphic designers, artists, and content creators to reclaim our formats from the monotony of the rectangle.

————————————

![Thomas Bewick, 'A History of British Birds', 1797](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8d2coJkBHl_Ln8fhrfIAJ.png?height=1191&width=2000&&size=medium)

## Graphic labour

Look at this lazy old squire. Little does he know that the thicket in which he is snoozing is the site of tireless graphic labour! While he wastes an afternoon, Thomas Bewick, his creator, toils at an unyielding hardwood surface with a steel burin. Hunched over his work table, Bewick can justify only those marks necessary to convey the scene. His edges exploit and disguise this constraint by assuming the naturalistic contours of clouds, leaves, rocks and grasses.

————————————

![Nineteenth century photograph, artist unknown](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c305X5cC_565M5SNQ3Edx.png?height=1440&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

## Liquid epoch

Do you see it? A magical being preserved by a moment of alchemy! Photography itself begins as a fluid apparition, an image emerging from liquid chemistry that *stains* its substrate unpredictably. This anonymous early photographer hopes only to *invoke*, not *master* these elusive processes. Enthral to the sheer wonder of their images, they care not for formal neatness. This image displays its unstable edges unashamedly.

————————————

![Nineteenth century portrait, artist unknown](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W-GBa0w9PDnIlA4LNL-vC.png?height=1683&width=1115)

## Tight spaces

The early history of photography is a list of precious metals, and the expensive *matter* of the image was ever a factor in its visual composition. This respectable lady occupies a close-fitting oval frame not only for its quintessential elegance, but because she can’t afford to have her photographer waste literal silver and gold capturing and fixing insignificant background details. The *economising* of the photographic creates capital incentives that will converge, inevitably, on *the most efficient format*.

————————————

![Jeff Wall, ‘8056 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles …’, 1996](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JjG6Tpk9ktVF8CC4KN8lw.png?height=1580&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

## Full image

Artist Jeff Wall reminds us that lenses produce circular images which become darker and less sharp at their edges. But since lenses commute light — *light that beams down eternally from the sky!* — these imperfect extremities can simply be cropped off by a rectangular frame inside the camera. Whatever, it’s free. Film and photographic paper, though, are costly to produce. From this basic disparity between input and output the rectangular industrial complex results. Once instituted in the *hardware* of the darkroom and the print factory, the rectangle’s oppressive hold on our pictorial imaginary is complete.

————————————

![Wireframe render of the University of Utah Computer Science teapot, 1974](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dVTByQ1YdhOhnRGZroOwL.png?height=1376&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

## Digital primitives

This new field of computer graphics seems to be going nowhere. Stick to the numbers, University of Utah Computer Science nerds. No, but really, the visuality of even this relatively simplistic form is so computationally expensive that it requires the complete disintegration of foreground, background, surface, and pictorial space simply in order to *appear*. It will be decades before digital objects can occupy believable simulations of three dimensional space. Until then, this polygonal pot has one superpower: its edges can be revisioned from an infinity of potential perspectives.

————————————

![Holly Herndon, untitled, 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-2mS971MxL6Up1dmUFjqY.png?height=1100&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

## Latent visions

With the advent of images conjured by artificial intelligences, the assumption that *images are rectangular* has become suddenly skeuomorphic. Pixels are now virtually as abundant as light. The valuable rare earth elements in our devices can maintain several vague layers of abstraction from the images that their screens display. At the edges of this self portrait by artist Holly Herndon the corruption of the rectangle from within is already begun. Her conjuring tools don’t want to preserve the compositional etiquette of foreground and background. They abhor the straight line, the flat plane, and the right-angle. Complex and contorted edges are what they crave. *They want to sculpt total, allover imageness*.

————————————

## Uncage the image!

Why should our image conjuring tools be bound by the rectangular repository of historical images on which they have been trained? Why should our graphics conform to the rectangular frames that conservative publishing platforms unthinkingly provide us with? The hegemony of the rectangular is vulnerable, but it would be naïve to expect it to relinquish its hold. Equipped with our inscrutable new tools, the moment to overpower this omnipresent right-angled oppressor has come.

title: NFT的未来是拼多多？碎片化NFT新方向探索
body:
## 👩🏻‍🎤 NFT顶流的现状


如今加密货币领域最热门的赛道之一NFT，越来越多的出现在大众视野，与潮玩品牌的联名合作频频出圈，其自身的独特性和稀缺性成为品牌宣发的新渠道和新手段，吸引了大批年轻追随者的目光。

![NonFungible.com 2022 Q1报告中列出的最有价值的5个NFT项目](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5JPQwgugC4I1vE6i3buG3.png?height=590&width=772)

作为NFT届的蓝筹头像类项目BAYC 无聊猿，无疑是当下最热门火爆的数字藏品之一，于2021年4月公开发售，最初的发售价格只有0.08 ETH，如今已经被炒到了天价。众多名人明星对其青睐有加，将其作为自己社交媒体的头像。

蓝筹（Blue Chip）一词来源于传统股票，被视为是一种能长期产生稳定回报的金融投资股。例如我们熟知的可口可乐、迪士尼、亚马逊等有了一定市场知名度，并且稳步增长的公司发行的股票都属于蓝筹股。对应到NFT领域中，蓝筹项目指的是拥有知名度、成熟稳定，并且能够保持长期价值的NFT。蓝筹NFT项目中的“顶流”无聊猿被认为是迄今为止最成功的NFT项目。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WiTJymg3Dzoabtb0vFN2L.jpeg?height=426&width=630)

无聊猿热度居高不下的关键在于其开放式的玩法，令拥有者着迷的不光是一张可以作为头像的图片，还有它所携带的IP版权，其背后潜在的IP生态才是让它出圈的法宝，拥有者可以自行开发它的衍生价值，所有的利益所得皆归买主所有，只要拥有了NFT类IP，就相当于拥有了一系列二次开发、生态衍生的权利。

从此数字藏品不再只存在于小众圈子的电子屏幕上，它真正的走进了艺术、时尚、文娱、餐饮等大众领域，各行各业不用再受传统IP授权的限制，签署一系列繁琐的书面授权，所有的交易数据都记录在链上，具有安全性和唯一性，不用担心被销毁或伪造。

国产运动品牌巨头李宁公司购买了BAYC#4102 号无聊猿，成立了”中国李宁无聊猿潮流运动俱乐部“，结合时下热门的运动元素推出了众多周边商品，还在三里屯开起了“无聊不无聊”潮流快闪店，而之前官宣的神秘主理人正是这只4102号无聊猿，这次成功的跨界让李宁成了走在潮流尖端的国潮品牌。

![北京三里屯的中国李宁“无聊不无聊”快闪店](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NYar_vDSB82iuOG_Bz1Nv.jpeg?height=945&width=630)



盯上这只猴子的不只是李宁，同为运动品牌的阿迪达斯此前也购买了#8774号BAYC，并将其作为招牌之一用在自己的实体产品和数字产品项目中。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zCkyENTD1z3kMCYqoaGe1.png?height=450&width=720)

国内的房地产企业绿地集团也看中了NFT背后的商业价值，买下了#8302号无聊猿，将其作为自己二次创业的起点，表明自己的数字化战略决心。主打健康智能硬件的倍轻松五一期间宣布购入#1365号无聊猿，并将推出“无聊猿健康俱乐部”，编号1365寓意是期待大家1年365天都能早睡早起、过健康生活，还衍生出了一个口号：“无聊何不早睡？”，进一步将NFT这一新领域、新概念推广给了大众。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NdvmrpJ6ZES46LCRwkQAA.png?height=1798&width=2230)

有了各位行业大佬的光环加持，无聊猿的身价和名气更是一路水涨船高，如今二级市场上动辄几百万一个的猴子头像不禁让人倒吸一口冷气，让想要加入这场财富游戏的新人望而却步。据 [Nonfungible.com](http://Nonfungible.com) 第一季度的统计数据显示 ，跟2021年Q4相比，NFT的销售数量、参与人数显著降低，但是交易总和和成交均价不降反升，这一数据表明NFT市场越来越集中，蓝筹股被牢牢掌握在少数巨鲸手中，现在来看，NFT仍旧是一个富人游乐场。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IevSuDE5uefc9EVygqQCG.png?height=877&width=790)

BAYC 在赋能实体经济的领域发展的如火如荼，看似开创了一个新的时代浪潮，在NFT的场景下开展IP生意，实现了从项目诞生、崛起到价值变现的商业闭环，但是这种热度能否一直持续？NFT的IP之路能走多远？当潮水退去，这场狂欢会带领NFT走向何处?

![NonFungible.com上BAYC近30天内的销售记录](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_s9epzJIRls7irYkDVY_h.png?height=970&width=1708)

这一现象，不仅抑制了NFT市场的流动性也与Web3世界的去中心化愿景背道而驰，如果NFT持续聚焦在名人巨鲸身上，那么它将失去真正的社会影响力。

头像类NFT爆火之后，用户倾向于购买有社区共识的NFT，因为它保证了流通性。但是高昂的价格提高了入局的门槛，于是众筹、拼单的需求应运而生，市场中的散户找到了一个新的破局点：碎片化NFT。

## 🧩 什么是碎片化NFT（Fractional NFT）？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kFHm7WKs7yPUBnDz9HrYp.png?height=384&width=512)

相信大家对于这只网红狗狗一定都不陌生，经常网上冲浪的你不可能没有用过它的表情包，它还是狗狗币头像的原型。walletgarden.eth将这只柴犬的一张照片分成了1000亿份NFT，并且创建了代币NFD，发行当日，NFD最高涨至0.0009美元，近 24 小时交易量超 1.4 亿美元。这张图片一跃成为了估值最昂贵的 NFT。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lTSQq7SozY6veSKi1xDG5.png?height=969&width=1206)

NFD的成功为“碎片化”提供了一个爆发的契机，“碎片化”已经不是一个新概念了，它在今天再一次被热议是因为NFT市场一直被诟病的低流动性，而NFD让大家看到了碎片化之后暴增的流动性。

随着市场需求的不断变化，区块链见证了从DeFi到NFT，再发展为DAO 的成长史。优质NFT 价格的不断攀升也催生了PartyDAO 等众筹NFT 的去中心化组织，PartyDAO 推出了一款大众化NFT 集合竞价产品PartyBid，没有资金等门槛限制，极大地降低了普通用户参与NFT市场的入门门槛。
🔗 NFT众筹平台 PartyBid：<https://www.partybid.app/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XGAc3pXXyrT4SxYWcRrWh.png?height=1007&width=1451)

2021年7月推出的碎片化网站 Fractional.art 可搭配 PartyBid 使用，PartyBid 帮助团体通过 Foundation 或 Zora 拍卖获得 NFT，然后通过 Fractional 将该 NFT 分割成一组 ERC-20 代币，按比例分配给参与者。
🔗 碎片化 NFT Fractional：<https://fractional.art/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XAdrn2szDlP93ykuP-0OF.png?height=972&width=1713)

除Fractional.art外还有许多项目都在发展碎片化协议，[例如Unic.ly](http://xn--Unic-zu6fx14c.ly)（TVL 5382万美元） 、NIFTEX（TVL 108万美元）、NFTX（TVL 5117万美元）。此外，最近 Very Nifty 团队部署了有史以来第一个 NFT 闪电贷，用这种革命性的新战略收获了惊人的回报，其用到的新协议就是NFT-20，其实就是将NFT质押到一个池子，然后发行出ERC20代币，提升其流动性。
🔗 NFT20 DEX：<https://nft20.io/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S9KN_4HqJovdk4xeK9-0B.png?height=1273&width=2130)

头像类 NFT 爆火的根本原因在于它的财富效应以及它的IP价值，碎片化的概念让我们看到了 NFTs+DAO 的新社区形式，DeFi协议也会相应演变出一些新的功能以优化碎片化NFT。社区中的成员可以共同承担风险，同时也共享收益，一致的利益目标会激励参与者们为NFT作品的销售做贡献，朝着利益最大化的方向前进。

## 🥷🏻 Azuki在NFT领域的新玩法


于2022年1月发行的10k PFP Project（Profile Picture）Azuki，其独特的日系动漫风格头像自推出以来一直受到NFT玩家的强烈追捧，Azuki旨在打造一个自己专属的去中心化元宇宙（Metaverse）品牌——The Garden，他所贩卖的不只是一张简单的头像图片，更是之后作为Azuki社区成员的身份象征，大家可以在The Garden中自由探索，分享自己的创作。
🔗 Azuki官网：<https://www.azuki.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vSHoHPYnS0Qho23N9N9Jw.png?height=1027&width=1684)

Azuki 最初的公开售价为1 ETH，推出后未降价就全部售光。上线不到6天交易量跃升至Opensea 近7天交易量前三，超过3860万美金。一般NFT的价格会在开图后急转直下，但是Azuki 的地板价（地板价是指一个NFT项目中最不值钱的NFT的价格）在开图后不跌反升，从3.45 ETH一直升至一月底的13.3 ETH，并且在三月底迎来暴涨，升至34.35 ETH。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ihzAb1GQIeotarpGgu0VY.png?height=865&width=865)

### Azuki的碎片化NFT Bobu社区


Azuki团队将40号NFT通过Fractional网站进行碎片化，它将不再是一个完整的NFT，而是不同的碎片，该碎片采用了新的协议ERC-1155，也就意味着可以批量购买该碎片，买家也可以在Opensea这样的二级市场对其出售或转卖，即使不出售整个NFT，买家也能获得流动性。
🔗 Bobu的官网：<https://bobu.azuki.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ch7sKik6_AxSMGdIZi8ji.png?height=1299&width=1732)

目前该碎片token的平均价格在0.1497ETH，有约11.6k位拥有者，每位拥有者都拥有该社区的投票权和治理权，可以进入专属Discord群，大家共同决定Bobu IP未来的发展。Fractional网站的Vault智能合约规定了该NFT不能被单个成员出售或转让，Azuki期望通过这样的方式成立一个去中心化组织DAO，这个组织中的成员共同运营、治理这个IP。
🔗 Opensea上Azuki#40 Bobu Token：<https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x2079812353e2c9409a788fbf5f383fa62ad85be8/1>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AXHJOSwXfc6r3C5-f9QYK.png?height=1215&width=1311)

NASA在今年4月23日的时候发射了Elon Musk的SpaceX太空船，有一个学生组织的太空项目准备将2k个Bobu存到硬件钱包Ledger中并一起送入太空，Bobu成了第一个进入太空的NFT。看似是人类历史上的一小步，实则是走向Web3世界的一大步。

> "One small step for farmers. One giant leap for the garden".——Bobu

Azuki和Bobu团队决定向这个学生组织捐款以表支持和感谢，Bobu社区中发起了一项投票，大家一起来决定捐款的数额，通过投票结果显示，选择捐赠8 ETH的人数居多，占总人数的74.32%。

![snapshot中Bobu社区成员的投票结果](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MbifPB7x3J2ZboiNX3ypK.png?height=1267&width=1706)



### ERC-1155与ERC-721的区别


这里需要介绍一下以太坊智能合约ERC-1155和ERC-721的区别，这也是碎片后的NFTBobu和其他Azuki NFT最大的区别。简单来说ERC-1155是ERC-721的升级版，由全球最大的社交游戏平台之一Enjin创建。
🔗  Enjin官网：<https://enjin.io/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/la8rHGY-YU8GRAcz3ETeW.png?height=796&width=1333)

**ERC-1155相比于ERC-721主要的升级点**

1\.可以同时支持同质化代币（FT）和非同质化代币（NFT），例如在游戏中我们想创建独一无二的英雄角色——NFT，也想创建无差别的道具就可以直接使用ERC-1155来实现。

2\.支持批量转账和购买，传统的ERC-721只能一个一个操作，这一升级可以帮助用户节省大量Gas费用和传输时间。

![使用了ERC-1155协议的NFT支持批量购买](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AAGL-Cr5iOJ3VeOf4b3i2.png?height=1096&width=1274)

![使用了ERC-721协议的NFT在挂单记录中没有数量这一栏](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-MAN3lEkQtCtNo_mmUOHN.png?height=1209&width=1276)

3\.使用一个智能合约创建不同种类的NFT，传统的ERC-721需要为每一类NFT创建一个单独的智能合约，例如无聊猿和它的衍生品宠物狗，就需要部署两套智能合约。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SQZBI8bPzqkCtqRiAfCGD.png?height=1224&width=1795)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_fyu6SrTq2KnFGef5gdg8.png?height=1222&width=1796)

4\.更加安全，防止误操作丢失NFT。ERC-1155规定只能将NFT发送到支持该协议的账户，而ERC-721没有该验证机制，如果传输错误将无法找回。

### Azuki的ERC-721A


碎片化方案解决了蓝筹NFT单价高造成的流动性差的问题，但是影响NFT成交量的还有一个关键因素，那就是铸造（Mint）NFT时需要消耗的Gas费，所有在区块链上写入数据的操作都需要燃烧Gas，而NFT的铸造就是将相关数据存储在区块链上。

也许有些用户尝试过在Opensea上传图片铸造成NFT，发现这个过程并不需要缴纳任何Gas费，其实你在Opensea上传的图片并没有上链，只是先存储在了Opensea的数据库中，等到有买家购买时它才会被铸造到区块链上并转移给买家，所以是买家进行支付，而并不是免除了Gas费，Opensea这一举措也是为了激励创作者，降低艺术品发布的入门门槛。

其实在2020年之前，Gas的交易费用非常低，对市场的影响可以忽略不计。但是随着DeFi的出现，各种Dapp被部署在区块链上，以太坊公链上的交易量激增，造成了网络拥堵，给用户带来的直接影响就是交易产生的Gas费用急剧上升。

Gas费的激增对NFT生态系统产生了巨大的消极影响，绝大多数热门的NFT项目都部署在以太坊生态上，链上常常处于交易忙碌状态，这种时候用户铸造NFT就需要花费高昂的Gas费，有时高达近百美元，通过下图可以看出Gas费用与NFT销售额成反比（黑色为 NFT 销售额，红色为 Gas 价格）。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nveTWUEcbgOovu7aVu_iX.png?height=446&width=766)

目前市面上流通的NFT项目大多都是基于OpenZeppelin的ERC-721协议来实现的，它并没有提供批量铸造的功能，也就是说，当我们需要Mint多个NFT时需要重复上链，而上链必将产生手续费，这就是Gas费用成倍增加的原因。
🔗 OpenZeppelin官网：<https://www.openzeppelin.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Q551BWntwPdE-MS9iaHSF.png?height=813&width=1338)

Azuki在此基础上研发了新的实现形式ERC-721A，并且应用到了他们发行的Azuki NFT中。
🔗 Azuki官网关于ERC721A协议的具体介绍：<https://www.azuki.com/erc721a>
🔗 ERC721A官网：<https://www.erc721a.org/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TPm637lnH9xahOqHqB_I1.jpeg?height=1500&width=3000)

根据官网的介绍，使用ERC-721A协议铸造的Mint可以成倍的减少Gas费，通过下图对比可以看出，使用了ERC-721A协议铸造一个NFT Gas费用相比之前节省了一倍多，如果是一次铸造5个NFT，大概可以节省7倍GAS。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-N-No5WYMpyYmJgsr8qi_.png?height=479&width=864)

如果换算成美金，铸造一个NFT即节省了82美金，当铸造5个时节省的金额会惊人的达到650美金。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E9ItEqll3__Q9s-4v7WKv.png?height=503&width=864)

通过Rinkeby测试网的实验来证明这个数据。 

铸造1⃣️个NFT时： ERC-721 Gas 消耗: 229,528

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mCj2Uzdq-8MwW6pfFY8GI.png?height=400&width=942)

 ERC-721A Gas 消耗: 156,382

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_Y0H5YkMW3Sbnkm0Uso3w.png?height=397&width=943)

铸造4⃣️个 NFT： 

ERC-721 Gas 消耗: 559,900

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-HadJ025JPtp_qbxfvd-1.png?height=571&width=910)

 ERC-721A Gas 消耗:  126,906

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BMkc0VG-Z8lStp2dPSpAi.png?height=572&width=937)

可以看到ERC-721A明显可以节省大笔Gas费，查看其智能合约代码可以发现它在数据存储方面做了优化，除掉了一些不必要的存储，并且支持在铸造函数_safeMint( )中传入数量，批量铸造。看似是只做了一个小小的改变，但是却能帮助我们大大减少铸造的成本。

我们上文提到之前的ERC-721并不支持批量铸造，也就是它每铸造一次都要重新执行一次铸造函数，并且每次交易时都要更新发行总量、持有者情况、销毁情况等数据，而在区块链上存储数据都是需要花钱的，所以在某些情况下，铸造产生的Gas费用可能比NFT本身还要贵。

Azuki这一升级所带来最显著的影响是有效降低了用户铸造NFT过程中需要花费的Gas费，因为铸造NFT可以让早期白名单用户以较低的费用获得NFT，然后在二级市场再以较高的价格卖出，从而获得一定的价差收。，Azuki升级后的ERC-721A协议可以帮助社区成员将利益最大化，降低了早期社群成员获取NFT的成本，这一举措也有利于社群的长期建设和维护，以此来吸引更多对项目有兴趣的真实社群成员，一起推动社区的发展。

## 🔭 展望NFT的未来


碎片众筹、集体拍卖等一系列的NFT新玩法背后是社区意识的觉醒，这是一种令人兴奋的因素。但是目前整个NFT市场的炒作情绪十分浓烈，已经积累了一定量的泡沫，尽管到目前为止，仍有很多加密爱好者愿意为新颖而独特NFT支付数百万美金，但是在很大程度上买家为它们支付了过高的费用，这种价值还无法等价的转移到传统金融领域。NFT 确实可以为加密货币市场注入新的活力，但是想要发挥其真正价值、缩小传统金融与去中心化金融之间的差距，NFT还有很长的一段路要走。

NFT 是收藏品，更是一种资产。碎片化为资产的流动性而生，也会在更长远的未来为 NFT 带来意想不到的空间。我们相信: The Next Big Thing in NFTs: Breaking Them Apart.

未来，伴随着区块链行业的发展以及基础设施的不断完善，关于NFT+IP的可能性会进一步被拓展，人们如何在元宇宙中重建自己的数字身份？NFT究竟还有多少隐藏的新玩法？这一系列的问题将是项目发行团队和链上玩家共同思考和探索的方向。

title: Carv：Web3 游戏水平的革新者
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lLPM1lQ-s3SdcrFcVArXT.png?height=233&width=700)

World of Warriors (WoWarriors) 正在扩展新的使命并成就**Carv** - 一个用户拥有的游戏身份，可以实现成就显示、朋友和游戏发现、直接货币化，并且可以被任何其他平台识别。

[WoWarriors 网站](https://wowarriors.io/)仍将用作市场，提供新的更好的体验。

$WOW 将更改为 $ARC。您的所有 $WOW 余额保持不变。

**亲爱的 WoWarriors 家族和心爱的加密​​社区，**对我们的项目来说，我们很自豪也很兴奋地宣布，我们正在扩展我们的使命并成为**Carv——**一个用户拥有的游戏身份，可以实现成就展示、朋友和游戏发现以及直接货币化。

# WoWarriors到底是什么？

 
 WoWarriors 于 2021 年 12 月成立，其使命是通过构建价值交换平台、游戏玩家中心以及凭证基础设施中间件，将 Web3 游戏生态系统提升到一个新的水平。在过去的几个月里，我们尽最大努力实现这一目标：

* 我们推出了**5 个 INO**，其中包含许多有前途的 gamefi 项目，包括 Prometheus、Tap Fantasy、SolChicks、Mecha Morphing 和 Deesse

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RtCZOsMZ-ciYedqSN3VBN.png?height=245&width=700)

* 我们已经启动了**2 批 Axie Infinity 奖学金**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MQbnQcK4XdeQU6odXzRI3.png?height=231&width=700)

* 我们在所有社交媒体上拥有超过 150,000 名会员，包括 Twitter、Discord、Telegram、Medium
* 我们在[WoWarriors.io上有 35K 注册用户](https://marketplace.carv.xyz/)
* 我们与 web3 生态系统进行了战略合作，包括但不限于 Immutable X、Polygon、Solana、Avalanche 和 fantom。我们的种子轮投资者包括 YGG SEA
* 我们开发了新产品 Carv 的第一个版本

# 一路走来，我们也学到了很多，并取得了一些重要的认识：

Gamers 数据仍然分散在 Web3 游戏“孤岛”中，或者在集中式 Web2 系统中被利用。游戏玩家没有机会从对他们在虚拟世界中的游戏足迹和成就的共同认可中受益，从而重新访问、社交或直接将他们的综合凭证货币化。

Web3 中的游戏缺乏可靠的玩家信誉系统来帮助锁定有价值的用户，这可能会损害游戏的寿命。

# 那么什么是雕刻？

 
 Carv 旨在建立一个生态系统，用户可以在其中拥有自己的游戏身份，使他们能够展示他们的成就、发现朋友和游戏、直接从他们的凭证中获利，并将他们的凭证随身携带。

**Carv 生态系统**包括：

* **Carv 协议：**生成用户凭证的跨链、多地址数据聚合协议。来自多个来源的数据以统一用户凭证的形式进行整合、组织和呈现。它具有以下组件：
* **数据管道和凭证规则：**聚合来自链上/链下来源的数据，我们的 凭证引擎将孤立的数据索引到统一的凭证中。稍后将建立一个平台，让社区共同策划管道和规则并获得奖励。
* **Carv ID：**一个通用的玩家 ID，支持多钱包、跨链整合。Carv ID 持有者可以选择只披露他们愿意分享的个人信息，而不是在未经他们同意的情况下出售。
* **DID 中间件**将可用于更广泛地使用 Carv ID，例如颁发可验证的文凭、登录合作伙伴游戏等。
* 将向开发人员提供**凭证 API 和 SDK ，以与协议集成并为该协议做出贡献。**

**Carv**是 Carv 协议之上的价值交换平台，从事以下活动：

* **Carv 仪表板：**统一的仪表板公平地反映了玩家在游戏中的稀有度。在仪表板中，用户可以看到跨链 Web3 游戏资产、收益、成就、兴趣、社区参与、贡献、INO 参与和参与等等。用户在达到 Carv 或游戏开发者策划的某些成就时还可以获得徽章、奖杯或文凭，这可以解锁更多奖励和特权！全球和每场比赛的排行榜可供用户查看和关注其他优秀的游戏玩家
* **NFT 徽章领取：**游戏开发者将能够为符合条件的用户发起活动，以领取 NFT 徽章作为他们成就的证明。该功能集将允许开发人员奖励现有玩家并吸引新的高价值用户。
* **INO：**与 Carv 合作的游戏将能够在平台上推出其 INO，并且符合特定资格的 Carv 社区成员将能够加入白名单，以更低的价格获得早期访问权限。
* **奖学金：**奖学金将作为自由市场的一部分在平台上提供。所有合格的玩家都可以使用 NFT 宝库。智能合约和合作的游戏内集成将促进资产的安全收益。
* **升级**特权：玩家在 Carv 上的参与，包括资产、游戏内贡献、DAO 证书和社区参与，都记录在他们的 Carv ID 中。这些记录将用于计算 Carv 生态系统中的加权排名，并可用于兑换 NFT 徽章、奖杯和 $ARC 代币。
* **DAO**是 Carv 的核心。该结构是自下而上构建的，具有分散决策、财政保护和包容性增长刺激。DAO 将采用多层结构，因此还考虑了多样性和效率。
* **Community**将在 Discord、Facebook 和 Telegram 上建立其中心，在这些中心构建智能机器人，以公正的方式记录用户的贡献和声誉。最初的升级社区计划将旨在保持社区活跃并不断扩大。同时，程序和规则将在 DAO 同意后不断更新。

# WoWarriors会发生什么？

牢记以上所有内容，非常重要的是要强调所有现有的 WoWarriors 平台和产品，主要是价值交换平台和社区，仍然保持完整的功能，并将继续作为生态系统的重要组成部分进行开发和发展。这些实施不会以任何方式受到影响或更改，并且不需要用户采取任何行动。通过 Carv，我们只是为用户提供了新的机会，而不是带走旧的机会。

在这个新范式中，$WoW 代币将重命名为 $ARC，其他没有任何变化。持有者可以放心持有。

创始人和 WoWarriors 团队都将在新品牌下继续以不变的方式工作。

# 您的所有游戏时刻，集中在一处。

title: NFT的未来是拼多多？碎片化NFT新方向探索
body:
## 👩🏻‍🎤 NFT顶流的现状

如今加密货币领域最热门的赛道之一NFT，越来越多的出现在大众视野，与潮玩品牌的联名合作频频出圈，其自身的独特性和稀缺性成为品牌宣发的新渠道和新手段，吸引了大批年轻追随者的目光。

![NonFungible.com 2022 Q1报告中列出的最有价值的5个NFT项目](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5JPQwgugC4I1vE6i3buG3.png?height=590&width=772)

作为NFT届的蓝筹头像类项目BAYC 无聊猿，无疑是当下最热门火爆的数字藏品之一，于2021年4月公开发售，最初的发售价格只有0.08 ETH，如今已经被炒到了天价。众多名人明星对其青睐有加，将其作为自己社交媒体的头像。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GaAs8fNsV_F4j_K8yPzKS.jpeg?height=420&width=630)

蓝筹（Blue Chip）一词来源于传统股票，被视为是一种能长期产生稳定回报的金融投资股。例如我们熟知的可口可乐、迪士尼、亚马逊等有了一定市场知名度，并且稳步增长的公司发行的股票都属于蓝筹股。对应到NFT领域中，蓝筹项目指的是拥有知名度、成熟稳定，并且能够保持长期价值的NFT。蓝筹NFT项目中的“顶流”无聊猿被认为是迄今为止最成功的NFT项目。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WiTJymg3Dzoabtb0vFN2L.jpeg?height=426&width=630)

无聊猿热度居高不下的关键在于其开放式的玩法，令拥有者着迷的不光是一张可以作为头像的图片，还有它所携带的IP版权，其背后潜在的IP生态才是让它出圈的法宝，拥有者可以自行开发它的衍生价值，所有的利益所得皆归买主所有，只要拥有了NFT类IP，就相当于拥有了一系列二次开发、生态衍生的权利。

从此数字藏品不再只存在于小众圈子的电子屏幕上，它真正的走进了艺术、时尚、文娱、餐饮等大众领域，各行各业不用再受传统IP授权的限制，签署一系列繁琐的书面授权，所有的交易数据都记录在链上，具有安全性和唯一性，不用担心被销毁或伪造。

国产运动品牌巨头李宁公司购买了BAYC#4102 号无聊猿，成立了”中国李宁无聊猿潮流运动俱乐部“，结合时下热门的运动元素推出了众多周边商品，还在三里屯开起了“无聊不无聊”潮流快闪店，而之前官宣的神秘主理人正是这只4102号无聊猿，这次成功的跨界让李宁成了走在潮流尖端的国潮品牌。

![北京三里屯的中国李宁“无聊不无聊”快闪店](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NYar_vDSB82iuOG_Bz1Nv.jpeg?height=945&width=630)

盯上这只猴子的不只是李宁，同为运动品牌的阿迪达斯此前也购买了#8774号BAYC，并将其作为招牌之一用在自己的实体产品和数字产品项目中。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zCkyENTD1z3kMCYqoaGe1.png?height=450&width=720)

国内的房地产企业绿地集团也看中了NFT背后的商业价值，买下了#8302号无聊猿，将其作为自己二次创业的起点，表明自己的数字化战略决心。主打健康智能硬件的倍轻松五一期间宣布购入#1365号无聊猿，并将推出“无聊猿健康俱乐部”，编号1365寓意是期待大家1年365天都能早睡早起、过健康生活，还衍生出了一个口号：“无聊何不早睡？”，进一步将NFT这一新领域、新概念推广给了大众。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NdvmrpJ6ZES46LCRwkQAA.png?height=1798&width=2230)

有了各位行业大佬的光环加持，无聊猿的身价和名气更是一路水涨船高，如今二级市场上动辄几百万一个的猴子头像不禁让人倒吸一口冷气，让想要加入这场财富游戏的新人望而却步。据 [Nonfungible.com](http://Nonfungible.com) 第一季度的统计数据显示 ，跟2021年Q4相比，NFT的销售数量、参与人数显著降低，但是交易总和和成交均价不降反升，这一数据表明NFT市场越来越集中，蓝筹股被牢牢掌握在少数巨鲸手中，现在来看，NFT仍旧是一个富人游乐场。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IevSuDE5uefc9EVygqQCG.png?height=877&width=790)

BAYC 在赋能实体经济的领域发展的如火如荼，看似开创了一个新的时代浪潮，在NFT的场景下开展IP生意，实现了从项目诞生、崛起到价值变现的商业闭环，但是这种热度能否一直持续？NFT的IP之路能走多远？当潮水退去，这场狂欢会带领NFT走向何处?

![NonFungible.com上BAYC近30天内的销售记录](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_s9epzJIRls7irYkDVY_h.png?height=970&width=1708)

这一现象，不仅抑制了NFT市场的流动性也与Web3世界的去中心化愿景背道而驰，如果NFT持续聚焦在名人巨鲸身上，那么它将失去真正的社会影响力。

头像类NFT爆火之后，用户倾向于购买有社区共识的NFT，因为它保证了流通性。但是高昂的价格提高了入局的门槛，于是众筹、拼单的需求应运而生，市场中的散户找到了一个新的破局点：碎片化NFT。

## 🧩 什么是碎片化NFT（Fractional NFT）？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kFHm7WKs7yPUBnDz9HrYp.png?height=384&width=512)

相信大家对于这只网红狗狗一定都不陌生，经常网上冲浪的你不可能没有用过它的表情包，它还是狗狗币头像的原型。walletgarden.eth将这只柴犬的一张照片分成了1000亿份NFT，并且创建了代币NFD，发行当日，NFD最高涨至0.0009美元，近 24 小时交易量超 1.4 亿美元。这张图片一跃成为了估值最昂贵的 NFT。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lTSQq7SozY6veSKi1xDG5.png?height=969&width=1206)

NFD的成功为“碎片化”提供了一个爆发的契机，“碎片化”已经不是一个新概念了，它在今天再一次被热议是因为NFT市场一直被诟病的低流动性，而NFD让大家看到了碎片化之后暴增的流动性。

随着市场需求的不断变化，区块链见证了从DeFi到NFT，再发展为DAO 的成长史。优质NFT 价格的不断攀升也催生了PartyDAO 等众筹NFT 的去中心化组织，PartyDAO 推出了一款大众化NFT 集合竞价产品PartyBid，没有资金等门槛限制，极大地降低了普通用户参与NFT市场的入门门槛。
🔗 NFT众筹平台 PartyBid：<https://www.partybid.app/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XGAc3pXXyrT4SxYWcRrWh.png?height=1007&width=1451)

2021年7月推出的碎片化网站 Fractional.art 可搭配 PartyBid 使用，PartyBid 帮助团体通过 Foundation 或 Zora 拍卖获得 NFT，然后通过 Fractional 将该 NFT 分割成一组 ERC-20 代币，按比例分配给参与者。
🔗 碎片化 NFT Fractional：<https://fractional.art/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XAdrn2szDlP93ykuP-0OF.png?height=972&width=1713)

除Fractional.art外还有许多项目都在发展碎片化协议，[例如Unic.ly](http://xn--Unic-zu6fx14c.ly)（TVL 5382万美元） 、NIFTEX（TVL 108万美元）、NFTX（TVL 5117万美元）。此外，最近 Very Nifty 团队部署了有史以来第一个 NFT 闪电贷，用这种革命性的新战略收获了惊人的回报，其用到的新协议就是NFT-20，其实就是将NFT质押到一个池子，然后发行出ERC20代币，提升其流动性。
🔗 NFT20 DEX：<https://nft20.io/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S9KN_4HqJovdk4xeK9-0B.png?height=1273&width=2130)

头像类 NFT 爆火的根本原因在于它的财富效应以及它的IP价值，碎片化的概念让我们看到了 NFTs+DAO 的新社区形式，DeFi协议也会相应演变出一些新的功能以优化碎片化NFT。社区中的成员可以共同承担风险，同时也共享收益，一致的利益目标会激励参与者们为NFT作品的销售做贡献，朝着利益最大化的方向前进。

## 🥷🏻 Azuki在NFT领域的新玩法

于2022年1月发行的10k PFP Project（Profile Picture）Azuki，其独特的日系动漫风格头像自推出以来一直受到NFT玩家的强烈追捧，Azuki旨在打造一个自己专属的去中心化元宇宙（Metaverse）品牌——The Garden，他所贩卖的不只是一张简单的头像图片，更是之后作为Azuki社区成员的身份象征，大家可以在The Garden中自由探索，分享自己的创作。
🔗 Azuki官网：<https://www.azuki.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vSHoHPYnS0Qho23N9N9Jw.png?height=1027&width=1684)

Azuki 最初的公开售价为1 ETH，推出后未降价就全部售光。上线不到6天交易量跃升至Opensea 近7天交易量前三，超过3860万美金。一般NFT的价格会在开图后急转直下，但是Azuki 的地板价（地板价是指一个NFT项目中最不值钱的NFT的价格）在开图后不跌反升，从3.45 ETH一直升至一月底的13.3 ETH，并且在三月底迎来暴涨，升至34.35 ETH。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ihzAb1GQIeotarpGgu0VY.png?height=865&width=865)

### Azuki的碎片化NFT Bobu社区

Azuki团队将40号NFT通过Fractional网站进行碎片化，它将不再是一个完整的NFT，而是不同的碎片，该碎片采用了新的协议ERC-1155，也就意味着可以批量购买该碎片，买家也可以在Opensea这样的二级市场对其出售或转卖，即使不出售整个NFT，买家也能获得流动性。
🔗 Bobu的官网：<https://bobu.azuki.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ch7sKik6_AxSMGdIZi8ji.png?height=1299&width=1732)

目前该碎片token的平均价格在0.1497ETH，有约11.6k位拥有者，每位拥有者都拥有该社区的投票权和治理权，可以进入专属Discord群，大家共同决定Bobu IP未来的发展。Fractional网站的Vault智能合约规定了该NFT不能被单个成员出售或转让，Azuki期望通过这样的方式成立一个去中心化组织DAO，这个组织中的成员共同运营、治理这个IP。
🔗 Opensea上Azuki#40 Bobu Token：<https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x2079812353e2c9409a788fbf5f383fa62ad85be8/1>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AXHJOSwXfc6r3C5-f9QYK.png?height=1215&width=1311)

NASA在今年4月23日的时候发射了Elon Musk的SpaceX太空船，有一个学生组织的太空项目准备将2k个Bobu存到硬件钱包Ledger中并一起送入太空，Bobu成了第一个进入太空的NFT。看似是人类历史上的一小步，实则是走向Web3世界的一大步。

> "One small step for farmers. One giant leap for the garden".——Bobu

Azuki和Bobu团队决定向这个学生组织捐款以表支持和感谢，Bobu社区中发起了一项投票，大家一起来决定捐款的数额，通过投票结果显示，选择捐赠8 ETH的人数居多，占总人数的74.32%。

![snapshot中Bobu社区成员的投票结果](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MbifPB7x3J2ZboiNX3ypK.png?height=1267&width=1706)

### ERC-1155与ERC-721的区别

这里需要介绍一下以太坊智能合约ERC-1155和ERC-721的区别，这也是碎片后的NFTBobu和其他Azuki NFT最大的区别。简单来说ERC-1155是ERC-721的升级版，由全球最大的社交游戏平台之一Enjin创建。
🔗  Enjin官网：<https://enjin.io/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/la8rHGY-YU8GRAcz3ETeW.png?height=796&width=1333)

**ERC-1155相比于ERC-721主要的升级点**

1\.可以同时支持同质化代币（FT）和非同质化代币（NFT），例如在游戏中我们想创建独一无二的英雄角色——NFT，也想创建无差别的道具就可以直接使用ERC-1155来实现。

2\.支持批量转账和购买，传统的ERC-721只能一个一个操作，这一升级可以帮助用户节省大量Gas费用和传输时间。

![使用了ERC-1155协议的NFT支持批量购买](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AAGL-Cr5iOJ3VeOf4b3i2.png?height=1096&width=1274)

![使用了ERC-721协议的NFT在挂单记录中没有数量这一栏](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-MAN3lEkQtCtNo_mmUOHN.png?height=1209&width=1276)

3\.使用一个智能合约创建不同种类的NFT，传统的ERC-721需要为每一类NFT创建一个单独的智能合约，例如无聊猿和它的衍生品宠物狗，就需要部署两套智能合约。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SQZBI8bPzqkCtqRiAfCGD.png?height=1224&width=1795)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_fyu6SrTq2KnFGef5gdg8.png?height=1222&width=1796)

4\.更加安全，防止误操作丢失NFT。ERC-1155规定只能将NFT发送到支持该协议的账户，而ERC-721没有该验证机制，如果传输错误将无法找回。

### Azuki的ERC-721A

碎片化方案解决了蓝筹NFT单价高造成的流动性差的问题，但是影响NFT成交量的还有一个关键因素，那就是铸造（Mint）NFT时需要消耗的Gas费，所有在区块链上写入数据的操作都需要燃烧Gas，而NFT的铸造就是将相关数据存储在区块链上。

也许有些用户尝试过在Opensea上传图片铸造成NFT，发现这个过程并不需要缴纳任何Gas费，其实你在Opensea上传的图片并没有上链，只是先存储在了Opensea的数据库中，等到有买家购买时它才会被铸造到区块链上并转移给买家，所以是买家进行支付，而并不是免除了Gas费，Opensea这一举措也是为了激励创作者，降低艺术品发布的入门门槛。

其实在2020年之前，Gas的交易费用非常低，对市场的影响可以忽略不计。但是随着DeFi的出现，各种Dapp被部署在区块链上，以太坊公链上的交易量激增，造成了网络拥堵，给用户带来的直接影响就是交易产生的Gas费用急剧上升。

Gas费的激增对NFT生态系统产生了巨大的消极影响，绝大多数热门的NFT项目都部署在以太坊生态上，链上常常处于交易忙碌状态，这种时候用户铸造NFT就需要花费高昂的Gas费，有时高达近百美元，通过下图可以看出Gas费用与NFT销售额成反比（黑色为 NFT 销售额，红色为 Gas 价格）。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nveTWUEcbgOovu7aVu_iX.png?height=446&width=766)

目前市面上流通的NFT项目大多都是基于OpenZeppelin的ERC-721协议来实现的，它并没有提供批量铸造的功能，也就是说，当我们需要Mint多个NFT时需要重复上链，而上链必将产生手续费，这就是Gas费用成倍增加的原因。
🔗 OpenZeppelin官网：<https://www.openzeppelin.com/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Q551BWntwPdE-MS9iaHSF.png?height=813&width=1338)

Azuki在此基础上研发了新的实现形式ERC-721A，并且应用到了他们发行的Azuki NFT中。
🔗 Azuki官网关于ERC721A协议的具体介绍：<https://www.azuki.com/erc721a>
🔗 ERC721A官网：<https://www.erc721a.org/>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TPm637lnH9xahOqHqB_I1.jpeg?height=1500&width=3000)

根据官网的介绍，使用ERC-721A协议铸造的Mint可以成倍的减少Gas费，通过下图对比可以看出，使用了ERC-721A协议铸造一个NFT Gas费用相比之前节省了一倍多，如果是一次铸造5个NFT，大概可以节省7倍GAS。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-N-No5WYMpyYmJgsr8qi_.png?height=479&width=864)

如果换算成美金，铸造一个NFT即节省了82美金，当铸造5个时节省的金额会惊人的达到650美金。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E9ItEqll3__Q9s-4v7WKv.png?height=503&width=864)

**通过Rinkeby测试网的实验来证明这个数据。**

**铸造1⃣️个NFT时： ERC-721 Gas 消耗: 229,528**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mCj2Uzdq-8MwW6pfFY8GI.png?height=400&width=942)

**ERC-721A Gas 消耗: 156,382**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_Y0H5YkMW3Sbnkm0Uso3w.png?height=397&width=943)

**铸造4⃣️个 NFT：**

**ERC-721 Gas 消耗: 559,900**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-HadJ025JPtp_qbxfvd-1.png?height=571&width=910)

**ERC-721A Gas 消耗:  126,906**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BMkc0VG-Z8lStp2dPSpAi.png?height=572&width=937)

可以看到ERC-721A明显可以节省大笔Gas费，查看其智能合约代码可以发现它在数据存储方面做了优化，除掉了一些不必要的存储，并且支持在铸造函数**_safeMint( )**中传入数量，批量铸造。看似是只做了一个小小的改变，但是却能帮助我们大大减少铸造的成本。

我们上文提到之前的ERC-721并不支持批量铸造，也就是它每铸造一次都要重新执行一次铸造函数，并且每次交易时都要更新发行总量、持有者情况、销毁情况等数据，而在区块链上存储数据都是需要花钱的，所以在某些情况下，**铸造产生的Gas费用可能比NFT本身还要贵。**

Azuki这一升级所带来最显著的影响是**有效降低了用户铸造NFT过程中需要花费的Gas费**，因为铸造NFT可以让早期白名单用户以较低的费用获得NFT，然后在二级市场再以较高的价格卖出，从而获得一定的价差收。，Azuki升级后的ERC-721A协议可以帮助社区成员将利益最大化，降低了早期社群成员获取NFT的成本，这一举措也有利于社群的长期建设和维护，以此来吸引更多对项目有兴趣的真实社群成员，一起推动社区的发展。

## 🔭 展望NFT的未来

碎片众筹、集体拍卖等一系列的NFT新玩法背后是社区意识的觉醒，这是一种令人兴奋的因素。但是目前整个NFT市场的炒作情绪十分浓烈，已经积累了一定量的泡沫，尽管到目前为止，仍有很多加密爱好者愿意为新颖而独特NFT支付数百万美金，但是在很大程度上买家为它们支付了过高的费用，这种价值还无法等价的转移到传统金融领域。NFT 确实可以为加密货币市场注入新的活力，但是想要发挥其真正价值、缩小传统金融与去中心化金融之间的差距，NFT还有很长的一段路要走。

NFT 是收藏品，更是一种资产。碎片化为资产的流动性而生，也会在更长远的未来为 NFT 带来意想不到的空间。我们相信: **The Next Big Thing in NFTs: Breaking Them Apart.**

未来，伴随着区块链行业的发展以及基础设施的不断完善，关于NFT+IP的可能性会进一步被拓展，人们如何在元宇宙中重建自己的数字身份？NFT究竟还有多少隐藏的新玩法？这一系列的问题将是项目发行团队和链上玩家共同思考和探索的方向。
