title: What are the best investment opportunities for BTC and ETH?
body:
For mature investors, what matters more than probability is how much you can make if you get it right, and how much you can lose if you get it wrong. The market is a random walk, and the risks and returns are often asymmetrical, which is the source of investment opportunities and risks. 

Therefore, high risk and high return is not a good investment opportunity. We transform the risk-return relationship into odds, and divide investment opportunities into three categories: worst, best, and medium.

[https://www.aicoin.com/xx/QbYEGk0b](https://www.aicoin.com/xx/QbYEGk0b)

The worst opportunity is high success rate and low odds -- but this is the most common and preferred opportunity. "High success rates" are defined as higher odds of future gains, while "low odds" are defined as lower odds of future gains than losses. The truth is, people always die by what they trust most.

Countless crypto KOLs have taken a few super-blue chip projects that have fallen for years, believing that "value will eventually return." These currencies may eventually come to life, but for how many years? Five years, 10 years? How many five or ten years are there in life to test a judgment? These behaviors are fine from the perspective of classic value investing, but in my opinion, they are the worst investment opportunities.

The best investment is to make big bets when the “success rate and odds” are in your favor. This conclusion seems to be true nonsense, good and cheap stock, who wouldn't want? If you wait too long, there are too many variables and yields are not good. Second, when you judge an opportunity, do you dare to buy?

The easiest opportunities are always the worst, the best opportunities are the rarest and the hardest to grasp. Is there a way to overcome these two obstacles? This is the long-term value investment based on BTC and ETH, which is to combine the "best opportunity" and "worst opportunity" into a decent opportunity.

[https://www.aicoin.com/xx/QeZ6Jlve](https://www.aicoin.com/xx/QeZ6Jlve)

So this method to obtain excess returns, it is necessary to do two things: the first is to grasp the inflection point of the winning rate. Cryptocurrencies always accelerate in an overvalued state and continue to slump in an undervalued state. If the odds are high, we must buy at the inflection point of the winning rate, and if the odds are low, we must sell at the inflection point of the winning rate. The judgment of the inflection point is to test our ability to open a position. This requires an understanding of the crypto industry, rich information channels, and a study of market styles. To study the psychology of other investors requires strong gaming ability.

The second is the flexibility of the position. I usually are low position, only to the fundamentals and market sentiment resonance inflection point, just resolutely add to the position, this is the flexibility of position. This is what value investors in BTC and ETH do best. 

The last round of many star fund holdings are basically nothing new, are well-known head items. The difference is that they have a different valuation system and positioning system, keeping as many positions at high odds as possible and as few at low odds as possible.

But even if long-term investing solves the problem of low odds, it will not solve the threat of a black swan event. If "inflection point judgment" is a matter of judgment, "position flexibility" is about risk control systems. Risk control system generally starts from position, limits the highest position of a single currency, the principle of heavy position attack often triggers the risk control system, especially institutions. 3AC is the best example of this slump.

[https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/dont-understand-compounding-look-walter-schloss-2016-08-12](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/dont-understand-compounding-look-walter-schloss-2016-08-12)

[https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/dont-understand-compounding-look-walter-schloss-2016-08-12](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/dont-understand-compounding-look-walter-schloss-2016-08-12)

The simpler the approach, the more demanding it is on the user, the more prone it is to "survivor bias." Oddly enough, while no one is stupid enough to think that imitating Michael Jordan's moves will get you into the NBA, plenty of people think that imitating Warren Buffett's investing methods will make them big bucks. A black Swan is a risk for most people, but if you're on the side of most people's counterparties, it's a winning lottery ticket. .

The two core points of my investment system are:

1. Pay attention to the prevention of small probability risks.
2. odds priority, seize the opportunity of asymmetric risk and return. 

   Classical value investment advocates "certainty" and requires investment to eliminate "uncertainty" as much as possible. The so-called certainty is just human self-deception, while "random walk" is the essence of capital market, and random phenomenon inevitably contains two kinds of interdependent events with small probability:

   1\.Asymmetric opportunities where the return far exceeds the risk. 

   2\.Risky Black Swan events.

And these are really the same kind of events. For every victim of a "black swan event", there must be a beneficiary of a "high odds low win rate" investment system. Therefore, "uncertainty" is not only the source of risk but also the source of income. The small probability risk event caused by randomness is the cause of most people's loss, and seizing the opportunity of risk and income asymmetry is the king way to make money.

I believe that BTC and ETH are expected to be asymmetric opportunistic assets with much higher returns than risks, and at the same time they will survive this economic black swan cycle.

title: Accepting Flags
body:
Which flags are okay for Mundo Lingo to print, and which are not.

### Languages not Countries

Our flags represent languages spoken in certain regions and sometimes dispersed populations such as Hebrew.

### 📯 Self-determination

• We support the right to self-determination.  
 • We apply the policy of self-determination to native populations inside that region, not populations living abroad (exiled or not).  
 • The flag that flies freely inside that region is the flag we use for the languages and dialects of that region.  
 • If the region is annexed by a larger neighbour with its political capital outside of the region who prohibits the flag then the previous flag or alternative flags are considered if the desire by natives of that region to use that flag is well documented. 
 • If the region and its capital are taken over by a new political party native to that region and with it’s political capital inside that region then the new flying flag will represent this region so long as the previous flag isn’t banned by the state.

### 🚩 Multiple Languages = 1 flag

India is home to hundreds of languages, but with the lack of distinctive flags for each one, and the lack of demand for such flags, we concede that all these languages are represented by one flag; the Indian flag. This case is repeated for Canada, US, Switzerland, Ireland, Scotland, Catalunya, Singapore, Malaysia and many more.

### Safety

The above guidelines apply for Mundo Lingo worldwide. Our participants should have access to all flags on request, with an exception if the flag is prohibited in that region.

### Numbers

We print flags for languages with more than 500,000 speakers, no less.

title: 新版Axie Infinity能否焕发第二春？
body:
![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ZaOkTFpvWWP2Rn1wRk6MYQ.jpeg)

撰稿：凯尔

曾经的区块链游戏龙头Axie Infinity不复此前风光，在过去的几个月间，它接连陷入游戏通证暴跌、链上资产被盗等困境，日活跃用户由高峰时期的百万人降至数万人。

身处至暗时刻，Axie Infinity开发团队承认，游戏的热度衰退与通证经济模型设计缺陷以及可玩性不足有关。看到问题的Axie Infinity将如何改进？不久前，它正式发布了名为Origin的新版本游戏。这是一个有着全新界面、战斗机制、美术特效和故事情节的版本，承载着Axie Infinity重返高光的使命。

相比此前的游戏版本，Origin版本增强了策略玩法，玩家需使用牌组根据作战情况挑选卡牌进行对战；同时，新版本强调了免费属性，所有新玩家都可以免费领取3个初始Axies进行体验，以降低入场门槛；7月1日，Axie Infinity还上线了虚拟地块质押功能，当前有92%的虚拟地块处于质押状态。

根据CryptoSlam 7月12日的数据，过去一周里， Axie Infinity NFT的销售额比前7天增长了近198% ，达到138万美元。尽管这个数字相比其高峰期每周动辄上亿美元的销售额微不足道，但数字的增长意味着Axie Infinity的改版正在发挥效用。

按照规划，新版本的Axie Infinity在进行多个阶段的迭代后会开启正式赛季。该款游戏的定位也将随之改变，据其官方产品负责人Philip La透露，Axie Infinity将从一个「玩赚游戏」演变成一个「玩和赚游戏」。他的态度很明确 — — 希望用户在其中体会到游戏的乐趣，而不仅是为了赚钱。

> **Axie Infinity推出免费版降低入场门槛**

经历了加密市场的牛熊转换以及跨链桥被盗事故后，曾风靡一时的链游龙头Axie Infinity也跟着跌入了低谷。在去年8月的巅峰时期，Axie Infinity日活跃用户数曾高达100万以上，如今这一数字仅徘徊在数万人左右。

由高峰跌入谷底的Axie Infinity被一些业内人士认为将不可避免地走向衰败。这原本也符合游戏大行业的规律。不过，从近日的数据表现看，身处至暗时刻的Axie Infinity正焕发出一丝生机。

根据CryptoSlam 7月12日的数据，过去一周里， Axie Infinity NFT的销售额比前7天增长了近198% ，达到138万美元。尽管这个数字相比其高峰期动辄上亿美元的周销售额显得微不足道，但数字的增长意味着Axie Infinity正在走出低谷。

营收增加与该游戏迭代推出了「Axie Infinity：Origin」新版本有关，该版本主打「免费玩」以吸引新用户流量，同时推出了虚拟地块质押功能。

「Axie Infinity：Origin」目前支持通过Mavis Hub 下载客户端，测试版适配Android和iOS设备。从App看，这款游戏铺陈了全新的界面，战斗机制、美术特效和故事情节都有所改变。相比此前的游戏版本，新版本中Axie（小精灵）的统计数据不再与「健康、速度、技能和士气」等指标相关，所有的Axie都具有相同的基础生命值，同时也没有基于种类的优势和劣势。

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0\*ocsKZlhQQxYUKtBf)

Axie Infinity Origin版本游戏界面

Origin版本中，玩家主要使用卡牌进行对战，每名玩家派出3个小精灵，每个小精灵可以搭配符文并进行升级。在作战时，玩家将获得一个18张牌的牌组，每个回合可获得5张牌，每张牌都有不同的功能，最终玩家依靠出牌的策略以及小精灵的强度来取得胜利。

玩家可参与的对战模式也比此前增加了不少。新游戏版本中，分为冒险模式、排名赛以及锦标赛。其中冒险模式支持玩家自行闯关练习，排名赛则通过积分的形式统计排名，榜单靠前者可获得AXS通证奖励，锦标赛则会定期组织。

相比Axie Infinity Classical游戏版本，新版本强调了「免费」属性。所有「初学者」都可以在登陆游戏后免费获得3个初始Axie小精灵，随着冒险模式的升级，玩家还可以无偿解锁更多小精灵。这意味着，新玩家不必再充值加密资产购买小精灵才能进行游玩，这无疑降低了玩家的入场门槛。

当然，系统赠送的初始Axie也有一定局限性。初始Axie并不是NFT，不能交易或用于赚取SLP通证，其升级能力也较付费版的Axie弱一些。

这一改动吸引了许多新玩家前来。根据Axie Infinity官方公布的数据，自Origin版本发布以来，有超过60万个新增账户注册。

除了推出「免费玩」的版本外，Axie Infinity还于7月1日上线了虚拟地块质押玩法，该玩法允许游戏生态中的地块拥有者质押土地来获得AXS收入。根据Axie Infinity所在的Ronin区块链的浏览器数据，当前共有15330块地块处于质押状态，占据总量的92%。

> **Axie Infinity从「玩赚」走向「玩和赚」**

「Axie Infinity 正处于一个重要的过渡时期，因为我们在整个游戏中演变成一个更可持续的模型和叙事。」Axie Infinity背后开发商Sky Mavis的游戏产品负责人Philip La如此说道。

在过去的几个月间，Axie Infinity接连遭遇重创，市场中关于该游戏「不可持续」的声音愈发响亮。

一方面，随着加密资产熊市来临，以及游戏内两个主要通证AXS和SLP的不断增发，这两个作为玩家主要收入的资产大幅下跌。

根据CoinMarketCap的数据， AXS 目前的价格约为13美元，比去年11月创下的近 165 美元的峰值价格下跌了92%。与此同时，SLP价值为0.00367美元，相比 2021 年 7 月近0.4美元的峰值跌超99%。

通证价格下滑导致「打金」收入锐减，这是Axie Infinity用户大规模流失的主要原因。根据区块链分析公司Nansen今年3月发布的一份报告，在行情热度下降后，Axie Infinity的活跃用户从最高峰值下降了70%，Ronin链上Axie Infinity NFT的销量也回落至低位。

另一方面，今年3月，Ronin链连接以太坊的跨链桥遭遇了黑客攻击，共计损失价值 6.25 亿美元的加密资产。这一事故波及了大量的Axie Infinity玩家，游戏内的存款和取款也一度暂停。虽然后续Axie Infinity依赖Binance等平台的帮助，重新开放了取款通道，但不少玩家因为担心安全性问题从Ronin链撤出了资金。

这些接连发生的挑战，让处于困境中的Axie Infinity雪上加霜。据BeInCrypto Research数据显示，Axie Infinity 3月份销量暴跌8.16亿美元，销售额约为3100万美元，相比2月份下降了61%。反观过去一年，它创造了高达13亿美元的收入。

Axie Infinity官方后续也坦承，游戏内通证的经济模型设计存在问题，玩法上也有改进空间。而近期上线的Origin版本，便是该游戏在复盘改进后的一次重新出发，某种程度上承担了了Axie Infinity重返高光的使命。

准确地说，当前的Origin版本仍是一个雏形。根据Axie Infinity的开发规划，这个游戏版本还有四个更迭阶段，第一阶段是提升游戏内决策的数量，让游戏变得更有趣；第二阶段主要将重置游戏进度，并向排行榜前列玩家发放少量AXS奖励；第三阶段，游戏会增加 SLP 产出和消耗；最后，Axie Infinity才会开启第一个正式赛季。

当前，Axie Infinity已经进入了第二阶段，在社交媒体上，许多用户分享了他们在Axie Infinity的游玩经历，尽管当前游戏内提供的奖励并不多，但许多用户反映，新的卡牌对战机制，让这款游戏的可玩性大幅提高。「相比此前对战尤为依赖Axie精灵的属性和等级，现在的游戏更侧重策略比拼。」

在可玩性的塑造上更进一步，是Axie Infinity的一个重大目标，也意味着它的游戏定位转变。Philip La在最新博客中表示，Axie Infinity正在从一个「玩赚」游戏演变成一个「玩和赚」游戏。他的态度很明确 — — 希望用户在其中体会到游戏的乐趣，而不仅是为了赚钱。

据透露，未来Axie Infinity还会开发「土地不对称玩法」。即针对生态中拥有土地和未拥有土地的玩家，设计两套玩法机制，以让每一个角色都能积极参与并从中获得价值。

尽管如今的Axie Infinity仍较它的巅峰期相差甚远，但在Origin版本发布后，这款链上游戏终于止住数据全面下滑的颓势。7月7日，Sky Mavis 的联合创始人 Jeff Zirlin披露，在过去的 24 小时内已售出约2.2万个 Axies，比几周前24小时内售出的 7千个有所增加。

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0\*Rvoc39Ro7fsyrc8c)

Axie Infinity近期销售数据有所回暖

面对外界对Axie Infinity的种种质疑，Philip La也颇有信心地回应称，这款游戏仍然存在，并定期推出重大改进，「我们将继续推出更多游戏，应用我们随着时间的推移所学到的所有知识。」

作为链游领域的王牌项目，Axie Infinity能否通过模式改变持续保持增长势头，也是业内关注的重点。值得注意的是，即使在熊市中，仍有许多区块链游戏处于开发进程中，随着新游戏陆续登陆市场，王牌也会面临竞争考验。

title: 公会如何帮助Web3游戏价值增值？
body:
*撰写：Raymond Chng*

*编译：TechFlow intern*

### 1.帮助从Web2的游戏玩家进入Web3

例如，像Sipher等游戏的公会可以考虑如何吸引Web2的FPS/TD-FPS玩家来尝试一下Sipher。这可以从分享Web3的精神开始，从所有权到NFT的可组合性等等。

### 2.游戏设计

职业游戏玩家技术高超，因为他们能够在一定程度上 "打破游戏"。这种技术也可以帮助游戏设计，深入了解对专业游戏者的思考、玩家会做什么，最终对游戏进行逆向工程。

### 3.游戏的Beta测试

测试是游戏开发中的一个重要过程，目的是帮助发现错误，提供游戏机制的反馈等等。通常情况下，职业玩家是帮助进行beta测试的最佳人选，因为他们有着强大的游戏技术和直觉。

### 4.帮助建立游戏的初始社区

建立社区，有可能减少游戏的GTM成本。既然游戏需要花钱购买UA，为什么不从一开始就激励好的社区呢--来自公会社区的真实玩家。

### 5.增加玩家黏性

公会可以通过以下方式增加游戏与玩家之间的黏性：

* 为玩家组织活动
* 为熟练的玩家组织比赛
* 为玩家提供一个紧密的社区，产生社交沉浸感。

### 6.电竞团队

虽然一个游戏中只有前0.01%的玩家会有足够的技术参加电子竞技，但公会本身就拥有庞大的玩家基础，可以从中挑选玩家并组建专注于这些游戏的电子竞技团队，看看现在的Valorant就知道了。

### 7.粉丝管理

当Web3游戏发展到有大量职业玩家和流媒体报道的阶段时，公会就可以管理自己的玩家粉丝群，就像足球俱乐部管理粉丝一样。公会还可以出售商品、NFT门票等，这就产生了收入来源。虽然这个阶段可能还很遥远，但现在开始发展社区并为这个阶段做准备准没错。

title: 项目5：Immutable X——基于Zk-Rollup的NFT基础设施
body:
## 一、项目简介

Immutable X是首个针对以太坊 NFT 的 Layer 2 扩容解决方案，提供了即时交易功能，对于任何市场、游戏和去中心化的应用来说，Immutable X 可以提供零 Gas 费用交易，即时NFT 交易（每秒高达 9000 多笔交易），推动了可扩展性，并提供用户托管。

同时也为用户提供了极具吸引力的动态交易 UX（User Experience，用户体验）——一个不受限制的、开发者友好的平台，开发者可以为用户打造更多以太坊上成本高昂的同质功能，如交易、制作、独特奖励、投票、拍卖等。

Immutable X的核心技术方案是zk-rollup（零知识证明），简单来说就是在L2上的交易记录会通过批量成块的方式进行上链并于链上智能合约进行交互。

最大的NFT市场OpenSea、三大交易所之一的OKX都采用了Immutable X的解决方案。

## 二、代币经济和效用

### 代币经济

51\.74%的代币将用于生态系统的发展，25%的代币用于项目发展，私募轮占比14.26%，公开发售5%，基金会储备占4%。其中生态系统的发展包括每日奖励和开发者资助，用以奖励生态活跃用户和开发者。

![代币释放节奏](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AnoRmCLAiplW59plyPLyw.png?height=359&width=640)

### 代币效用

**交易：Immutable 协议费用的20% 必须以IMX支付。这笔费用可以直接用IMX支付，也可由Immutable协议将其他代币自动转换为$IMX进行支付。**

质押：质押$IMX可被奖励交易费用，用户的奖励将与他们在当月质押的$IMX数量成正比.同时要注意的是如要使用质押功能，需在30天内进行治理提案投票且至少满足拥有 Immutable X生态上的NFT或在30天之内进行过交易。

治理：代币持有者将能够通过去中心化治理对与代币相关的提案进行投票。提案将包括诸如如何分配代币储备、对开发者资助进行投票、激活每日奖励和代币供应变化等内容，还可以通过适当的去中心化治理流程添加其他提案类别。如果进行提交提案则需拥有一定份额的代币，但具体数值尚未公布。

## 融资情况

2018年，Immutable 由 Nirvana Capital和Continue Capital种子轮领投240万美元，**Coinbase**和Sora Ventures跟投。

2019年9月，Immutable 宣布完成了由 **Naspers Ventures（腾讯大股东南非报业）**和 Galaxy Digital EOS VC Fund 领投的1500万美元的首轮投资。

2022年3月，Immutable X 以 25 亿美元估值完成 2 亿美元融资，**淡马锡**领投，Mirae Asset、ParaFi Capital、Declaration Partners、**腾讯控股**等参投。

## 投资策略和估值

代币imx总发行量20亿，目前价格0.85美元，总市值17亿美元，已经低于最新融资时的价格（1.25美元），imx在2021年11月上线交易，在2022年12月会有一波大的解锁，目前总市值依然不低，需要耐心等待在熊市里一定能捡到更便宜的筹码。

imx从6月开始向合作项目收取服务费，而每一笔NFT交易都会带来imx代币的消耗，目前主要是服务以太生态，但是ZK-Rollup技术可以用于任何公链，随着项目的发展完全可能用到更多生态，长期看imx的估值没有天花板，。

title: 项目5：Immutable X——基于Zk-Rollup的NFT基础设施（20220713）
body:
## 一、项目简介

Immutable X是首个针对以太坊 NFT 的 Layer 2 扩容解决方案，提供了即时交易功能，对于任何市场、游戏和去中心化的应用来说，Immutable X 可以提供零 Gas 费用交易，即时NFT 交易（每秒高达 9000 多笔交易），推动了可扩展性，并提供用户托管。

同时也为用户提供了极具吸引力的动态交易 UX（User Experience，用户体验）——一个不受限制的、开发者友好的平台，开发者可以为用户打造更多以太坊上成本高昂的同质功能，如交易、制作、独特奖励、投票、拍卖等。

Immutable X的核心技术方案是zk-rollup（零知识证明），简单来说就是在L2上的交易记录会通过批量成块的方式进行上链并于链上智能合约进行交互。

最大的NFT市场OpenSea、三大交易所之一的OKX都采用了Immutable X的解决方案。

## 二、代币经济和效用

### 代币经济

51\.74%的代币将用于生态系统的发展，25%的代币用于项目发展，私募轮占比14.26%，公开发售5%，基金会储备占4%。其中生态系统的发展包括每日奖励和开发者资助，用以奖励生态活跃用户和开发者。

![代币释放节奏](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AnoRmCLAiplW59plyPLyw.png?height=359&width=640)

### 代币效用

**交易：Immutable 协议费用的20% 必须以IMX支付。这笔费用可以直接用IMX支付，也可由Immutable协议将其他代币自动转换为$IMX进行支付。**

质押：质押$IMX可被奖励交易费用，用户的奖励将与他们在当月质押的$IMX数量成正比.同时要注意的是如要使用质押功能，需在30天内进行治理提案投票且至少满足拥有 Immutable X生态上的NFT或在30天之内进行过交易。

治理：代币持有者将能够通过去中心化治理对与代币相关的提案进行投票。提案将包括诸如如何分配代币储备、对开发者资助进行投票、激活每日奖励和代币供应变化等内容，还可以通过适当的去中心化治理流程添加其他提案类别。如果进行提交提案则需拥有一定份额的代币，但具体数值尚未公布。

## 融资情况

2018年，Immutable 由 Nirvana Capital和Continue Capital种子轮领投240万美元，**Coinbase**和Sora Ventures跟投。

2019年9月，Immutable 宣布完成了由 **Naspers Ventures（腾讯大股东南非报业）**和 Galaxy Digital EOS VC Fund 领投的1500万美元的首轮投资。

2022年3月，Immutable X 以 25 亿美元估值完成 2 亿美元融资，**淡马锡**领投，Mirae Asset、ParaFi Capital、Declaration Partners、**腾讯控股**等参投。

## 投资策略和估值

代币imx总发行量20亿，目前价格0.85美元，总市值17亿美元，已经低于最新融资时的价格（1.25美元），imx在2021年11月上线交易，在2022年12月会有一波大的解锁，目前总市值依然不低，需要耐心等待在熊市里一定能捡到更便宜的筹码。

imx从6月开始向合作项目收取服务费，而每一笔NFT交易都会带来imx代币的消耗，目前主要是服务以太生态，但是ZK-Rollup技术可以用于任何公链，随着项目的发展完全可能用到更多生态，长期看imx的估值没有天花板，。

title: 今晚20点30分公布六月通胀数据 预测情况不容乐观 资金严重短缺 — 2022.7.13
body:
当前总结：FUD无处不在，连CPI数据都出现造假了，也真的是人才啊。今天晚上20点30分即将公布六月份的CPI数据，目前几个不同机构的预测几乎都在五月之上，最少加息75个基点已经成为了共识，而100也似乎并不是不能接受，主要就是看CPI数据后美联储官员的讲话吧，想来也和六月的时候讲的差不多。

尤其是非农的数据支持下，美联储自认是有这个底气的，很多小伙伴已经再说最近的下跌是市场对于CPI爆表的预期，预期后即便数据真的爆表也该触底反弹了。是不是真的能按照这种剧本走，我并不知道，也并不乐观，毕竟随着CPI的上升必然会产生更高的恐慌，即便是预期了该来的恐慌还是会来。

因为这种恐慌是自下而上的，即便不是风险市场的投资者都会陷入这场恐慌中，从目前的情况来看，不论是从宏观，抛压，资金，存量，甚至是情绪来看，虽然确实存在经济派和通胀派的博弈，但在七月加息的影响出现前，全部都是情绪面的预期，这种情况下震荡已经是最好的结果了，大规模的多空转换未必容易出现。

Twitter @Phyrex_Ni

截止到今天早晨八点的BTC持仓价格分布，从昨天晚上美股开盘前到现在BTC链上地址的变化数据上来看，相对于周一整体的地址转移有了小范围的降低，两边的极端价格中，远古持仓和高位套牢的筹码相比昨天美股开盘前的数据虽然稍微提升了一些，但依然是在正常的波动范围内，总减持量在1,100枚左右。

而22,000美金上方的整体BTC亏损筹码的减持也比美股开盘前增加了一些，总减持量将近6,800枚，其中之前高存量的26,000美金至31,000美金之间的筹码即便是BTC的价格出现了回落到20,000美金下方的情况后依然没有产生更多的变化，这也代表了“3”时代抄底的筹码也进入了躺平期，目前小幅度价格震荡无法影响。

而抛压重点的当前争端价格，可以看到相比昨天美股开盘前的转移量稍微小了一些，原因也比较简单，随着价格的连续下降，更多的获利筹码已经提前离场，而当前宏观看衰美国经济的情况下，抄底的数量也在下降，所以出现了即便是争端价格流通量都在降低的趋势。而该趋势在价格震荡区间只会愈演愈烈。

当前19,000美金至20,000美金堆积的BTC已经超过了211万枚。

从转入交易所的BTC数量来看，转入交易所的抛压确实是下降了一些，但也依然维持在上半年的高位。从URPD的数据中我们能看到较早前亏损筹码的减持是有少量的提升，那么带动减少的必然是当前争端价格的筹码，也就是意味着转入交易所抛压的数量和获利筹码的数量是成正比的。

而从交易所转出提现的数据来看，连续两天提现量都低于了转入的抛压，这一方面代表了购买力的不足，另一方面也是代表了宏观情况导致的看空情绪在增加，更多的投资者会等待CPI，GDP和加息的数据出现后在逢低抄底。毕竟这三个数据在目前的预期中都是以利空为主。

顺便说一句，虽然现在的基本面上确实都不利于风险投资的市场，甚至是BTC的永续合约中，资金费率也出现了多空转换的情况，但目前的流通量除当前争端外依然是处于低流通的情况，而随着价格的单方行情，并不排除会出现暴涨暴跌的情况，所以目前依然不是高杠杆合约的适合期，还需谨慎。

从昨天下午六点到今天上午十点三十分的交易所转入转出的细节数据可以看到，今天的抛压量确实是进入了减少的阶段，尤其是在欧美主力交易时区出现的主力抛压都有了大规模的抛压减少情况，这并不是好事，只能说明获利筹码越来越少，亏损筹码更多的在躺平。毕竟抛压少的同时购买力也在对应的降低。

从交易所的BTC存量情况来看，随着购买力的降低以及CPI和GDP数据的下降预期，更多的筹码选择暂时滞留在交易所，估计就是想看看宏观是否会发生变化，如果不会发生正向的变化，甚至出现恶化趋势，就果断的砸盘离场。从交易所的细节数据也可以看到，随着关键数据释放的临近，更多的交易所内存量开始离场。

昨天资金分析中已经给大家看了最近两年资金量走势，已经是明显的下跌状态了，而因为宏观形势的变化，即便已经是大幅度的下降，目前仍然未必是资金的低点。从USDT的数据来看，最近即便是工作日的资金量也已经是惨不忍睹，截止到今天早晨八点的资金情况仅仅和上半年的周末资金量等同，缺乏的资金一览无余。

即便是一度在加息初期准备逆袭的USDC也开始沉寂起来，尤其是截止到今天早晨八点的USDC转入交易所的数据可以看到，和USDT一样都是大幅度的减少，目前整体币市的资金量非常的不乐观，而在这种情况下，别说是反转，就是反弹暂时都很难看到希望，能维持震荡对于多空双方来说都已经是最好的表现了。

从最近48小时的BTC和ETH的抛压，以及USDT和USDC的转入数据对比来看，资金量确实是处于较大的弱势情况，不知道小伙伴是否还记的我写过一篇资金量和BTC价格的专题文章，有兴趣的可以去置顶贴里看看，目前的资金量能维持在现在的价格上，已经是因为流通量降低的“红利”了。

从目前的宏观局势来看，相比大家也都有了心理准备。美金指数继续在108的上方震荡，这还是CPI的数据没有出来，GDP的数据没有出来，七月的加息力度还没有公布并且尚未执行的情况下，随着每一个数据的出现，首先反应的必然是美金指数，涨到多少无法预测，但上涨应该是极大概率，带来结果就是风险投资减少

而DXY的上涨必然会带来美债的殖利率上升，果然在昨天小范围的下跌后，今天开始又在上涨，甚至是一年的短期美债利率都已经回到了3%，目前除了仍然在倒挂的十年期美债外，全部都回到了3%的上方。相信今天晚上的CPI数据出现后，美债又要经历一场较大规模的下跌。

受到美国经济衰退的预期影响，两油的价格也如预期一般降低到了100美金以内，也算是为了7月份的通胀数据（8月公布）做出了一些贡献，但是代价大家也都心知肚明。经济派的是否可以扭转非农数据以来的劣势，就要看今天晚上的CPI数据了。

注意黄金，注意欧元。

title: Brands 3.0 – Turning Customers into Owners
body:
![Paradigm Shifts in Brand Definition and Engagement ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qs1ifWIiWtsAy1p7LY1RE.png?height=400&width=850&size=medium)

*Web3 is shifting brand engagement from its top-down, extractive nature to be more symbiotic. Traditionally, brands had a corporatist nature advocating for the control of values by executive teams, which poorly aligned most valuable contributors. Top community members who harnessed on-ground insights were not tapped to become contributors but pushed out to be customers of dictated values.* 

*Brands 1.0 and 2.0 follow mass media, direct-to-consumer (D2C) playbook religiously, manufacturing the same standardized identity, and are falling out of relevance as their executive teams do.*

***Web3 is now presenting an opportunity for optimal retention and engagement— Brands 3.0*** 

*Blockchain-powered brands, brands 3.0, will transform D2C into collaborative and bidirectional engagement (C⟷B) which will thrive on contributions from a global talent pool segmented with reputation and incentivized with ownership economy —**Turning customers into contributors, stakeholders, and co-creators.***

### Future of Brand Engagement: The Why, The How, The What

To truly turn customers into stakeholders, new mechanism designs will depend on how contribute-to-earn quests are complemented with non-fungible and fungible tokens and tiers, *creating socio-economic systems based on proof of engagement.*

I will dive into Brands 3.0’s Golden Circle in three parts:

1. **(The Why) Brands 3.0 —  Transforming D2C into C⟷B,** is this article.
   1. Delving into why brand engagement will be redesigned, and how the evolution of brands is following same patterns as evolution of the Web.
2. **(The How) Brands 3.0 — Proof of Engagement (PoE),** delves into the technological foundation and mechanism design needed for the shift in the engagement paradigm.
   * *Nobody quite has been able to design the right mechanics around reputation, contribute-to-earn, and multi-tribal identity with a usable interface yet. The unlock’ll be the design of Proof of Engagement (both as status and financial upside) without hyper-financialization of the brand*
3. **(The What) Brands 3.0 — Proposed Mechanism Design,** dive into applications and results achieved on early genesis experimentations and the future — mobilizing communities.

### ***First, What is a brand?***

Your morning coffee, the sweater you are wearing, your online persona, the concert you are planning to go to, the musician you have on repeat, the software you love… and so much more are essentially *brands* – piecing meaning, utility, and belonging together.

Brands are the set of reputations, expectations, and experiences around products, services, and creators — and they operate with ***social consensus.*** 

From the wise words of [Headless Brands](https://otherinter.net/research/headless-brands/) —

> Brand is a cultural phenomenon that emerges only when these things come into contact with people. A brand lives in the minds of those who are aware of it. As a brand grows, it becomes more than a set of first impressions and associations. Its reputation precedes it. *In this way, a brand operates as a consensus system.*

For a brand, a strong reputation and community are hard to build and easy to destroy.  [There are over 30,000 new products introduced every year, and ](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[95 percent](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[ fail](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.) –– falling out of relevance.

### ***Community ⟷ Brand Symbiosis***

***A similar pattern to how the web has evolved over time can be seen in brands****. Since brands are catching up by integrating web evolution, we can extrapolate the past and present to define the future of what Brands 3.0 will look like.*

### Brands 1.0 — Read Only | Post-Industrialization Prescriptive Branding

![Buy this brand...Because it is better, purer &  stronger than all others. ok?](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PQH15GIS_rSBHq_a9TovN.png?height=378&width=694)

* **The earliest version of brands was prescriptive and dogmatic.** Top-down, read-only campaigns were used to *dictate* customers to believe pre-conceived slogans that advertised brand could bring happiness and perform better.
* **Brands 1.0 was the “read-only” web – a brand that was rigid, utility-focused, and not interactive in any significant sense.** Early branding and advertising were one-to-many. Mass-produced interactions through radio, newspapers, tv, and banners with no controls and forms to engage back for the customers.
* Since top bottlenecks were still mass production and global distribution, customer needs, values and relevance were secondary, thus not important.
* **Brands 1.0 was the first status and community formation based on one’s neighborhood.** Buyers were not able to globally engage, but the first form of communities around brands was formed where logos and packaging were used as the first symbols of community.

### Brands 2.0 — Read & Write | Rise of Interactivity, Social Connectivity, and User-Generated Content

*Web2.0 eliminated the cost to build a brand, powering the formation of micro-brands and customer networks as communities. However, with the standardized, top-down playbook of D2C, now it is more costly than ever to drive retention.*

![Bucket of D2C brands out of ocean of others executing the same engagement playbook](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VOuByBWwhnufg4SwswYCm.png?height=592&width=1280)

Brands 2.0 describes the current state of the brand engagement economy, which gave more content and usability for end-users compared to the earlier one-to-many brand incarnation.

> *Brands 2.0 also refers to the shift in the definition of “brand”. Instead of only products or corporations, any experience, service, creator, and product that have carved out its own niche and community in an increasingly overcrowded market became a brand.*

Rise of Brands 2.0 redefined engagement economy, yet it was still unscalable:

**1. Connected | Customers → Followers**

Increased use of social media connected local nodes of brand communities to one another, creating global connectedness to contrast brands. Customers got overwhelmed by top-down content resulting in disinterested views of advertising.

*Customers shifted into followers who could react but not act.*

**2. Interactive** (**Comment & Influence) | Customers positioned themselves as experts.**

Brands 2.0 created the participation to comment, and react on brand experience. This gave rise to one-in-a-million users becoming influencer for the brand by creating user-generated content. Influencers became the ambassadors pushing the brand narrative.

> *Influencers were the first proof of concept of the need for community input and contribution back to the brand. Yet, the influencer’s fame was the proof of work within that social network dictated by centralized algorithms, and this proof of work is not always aligned with the brand’s needs.* 
>
> *Same influencers started promoting many brands, repeating one-to-many marketing.*

**3. Direct-to-Consumer Engagement | Brands following the D2C playbook**

Brands have exhausted attention and consumption economy. Now, all brands are blending in, executing the same D2C and products are taking ownership of the community, and data.

### State of Brands 2.0

*Existing Web 2.0 take the ownership of the community away from the brand–– they are at best, saturated and, at worst, actively deteriorating.*

![Customers consuming top-down, standardized content. Facade of engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WdAaMQ9AlkpomFP4GVy2u.png?height=421&width=750)

**It has never been more expensive to acquire customers, and fans or challenging to retain them.**  *D2C acquisition costs skyrocketed by 60% over the last decade (with competition on ads, saturation in market, and declining effectiveness of Facebook “look alike audiences” following Apple’s App Tracking Transparency IOS 14 update)***. Thus, It has never been more important to incentivize customers.**

Now, there is a pressing need for brands to bypass the platform-centric marketing world of web2 and reclaim ownership of their digital consumer relationships to beat numbers in retention and lifetime value (LTV).

### Brands 3.0 — Own | Turning Customers into Owners (C⟷B)

With crypto, it is now possible to create the new engagement economy infrastructure **that powers the social and financial stake in a brand as a tool to drive followers and customers to become contributors to brands they use in deeper ways.**

> *Brands 3.0 refers to an infrastructure where instead of the brand being written and controlled by only a small group of experts, it is developed and shaped in full view of everyone, encouraging maximum participation — turning customers into co-creators, and stakeholders.*

![Poolsuite Tiered NFT-Membership Cards created effective and scalable engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q6Gki0OrsjQjNv2zc01EJ.png?height=1402&width=2872)

1. **Staying Relevant | Dynamic Product-Market Fit.**

By decentralizing taste, curation, and incentivizing giving quality insights and feedback, brands can create dynamic product-market fit and stay relevant through decades. These inputs do not necessarily give full ownership to the community but create bottom-up channels to harness value and contribution from community members.

**2. Unlocking Maximum Retention and Life Time Value | Contribute-to-earn.**

In status quo, customers cannot differentiate between brands as followers anymore. They harness deep untapped insights and emotions for brands that if scalably harnessed, can help bring universal data to unlock brands’ next engagement steps.

title: Brands 3.0 – Turning Customers into Owners
body:
![Paradigm Shifts in Brand Definition and Engagement ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qs1ifWIiWtsAy1p7LY1RE.png?height=400&width=850&size=medium)

*Web3 is shifting brand engagement from its top-down, extractive nature to be more symbiotic. Traditionally, brands had a corporatist nature advocating for the control of values by executive teams, which poorly aligned most valuable contributors. Top community members who harnessed on-ground insights were not tapped to become contributors but pushed out to be customers of dictated values.* 

*Brands 1.0 and 2.0 follow mass media, direct-to-consumer (D2C) playbook religiously, manufacturing the same standardized identity, and are falling out of relevance as their executive teams do.*

***Web3 is now presenting an opportunity for optimal retention and engagement— Brands 3.0*** 

*Blockchain-powered brands, brands 3.0, will transform D2C into collaborative and bidirectional engagement (C⟷B) which will thrive on contributions from a global talent pool segmented with reputation and incentivized with ownership economy —**Turning customers into contributors, stakeholders, and co-creators.***

### Future of Brand Engagement: The Why, The How, The What

To truly turn customers into stakeholders, new mechanism designs will depend on how contribute-to-earn quests are complemented with non-fungible and fungible tokens and tiers, *creating socio-economic systems based on proof of engagement.*

I will dive into Brands 3.0’s Golden Circle in three parts:

1. **(The Why) Brands 3.0 —  Turning Customers into Owners,** is this article.
   1. Delving into why brand engagement will be redesigned, and how the evolution of brands is following same patterns as evolution of the Web.
2. **(The How) Brands 3.0 — Proof of Engagement (PoE),** delves into the technological foundation and mechanism design needed for the shift in the engagement paradigm.
   * *Nobody quite has been able to design the right mechanics around reputation, contribute-to-earn, and multi-tribal identity with a usable interface yet. The unlock’ll be the design of Proof of Engagement (both as status and financial upside) without hyper-financialization of the brand*
3. **(The What) Brands 3.0 — Proposed Mechanism Design,** dive into applications and results achieved on early genesis experimentations and the future — mobilizing communities.

### ***First, What is a brand?***

Your morning coffee, the sweater you are wearing, your online persona, the concert you are planning to go to, the musician you have on repeat, the software you love… and so much more are essentially *brands* – piecing meaning, utility, and belonging together.

Brands are the set of reputations, expectations, and experiences around products, services, and creators — and they operate with ***social consensus.*** 

From the wise words of [Headless Brands](https://otherinter.net/research/headless-brands/) —

> Brand is a cultural phenomenon that emerges only when these things come into contact with people. A brand lives in the minds of those who are aware of it. As a brand grows, it becomes more than a set of first impressions and associations. Its reputation precedes it. *In this way, a brand operates as a consensus system.*

For a brand, a strong reputation and community are hard to build and easy to destroy.  [There are over 30,000 new products introduced every year, and ](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[95 percent](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[ fail](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.) –– falling out of relevance.

### ***Community ⟷ Brand Symbiosis***

***A similar pattern to how the web has evolved over time can be seen in brands****. Since brands are catching up by integrating web evolution, we can extrapolate the past and present to define the future of what Brands 3.0 will look like.*

### Brands 1.0 — Read Only | Post-Industrialization Prescriptive Branding

![Buy this brand...Because it is better, purer &  stronger than all others. ok?](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PQH15GIS_rSBHq_a9TovN.png?height=378&width=694)

* **The earliest version of brands was prescriptive and dogmatic.** Top-down, read-only campaigns were used to *dictate* customers to believe pre-conceived slogans that advertised brand could bring happiness and perform better.
* **Brands 1.0 was the “read-only” web – a brand that was rigid, utility-focused, and not interactive in any significant sense.** Early branding and advertising were one-to-many. Mass-produced interactions through radio, newspapers, tv, and banners with no controls and forms to engage back for the customers.
* Since top bottlenecks were still mass production and global distribution, customer needs, values and relevance were secondary, thus not important.
* **Brands 1.0 was the first status and community formation based on one’s neighborhood.** Buyers were not able to globally engage, but the first form of communities around brands was formed where logos and packaging were used as the first symbols of community.

### Brands 2.0 — Read & Write | Rise of Interactivity, Social Connectivity, and User-Generated Content

*Web2.0 eliminated the cost to build a brand, powering the formation of micro-brands and customer networks as communities. However, with the standardized, top-down playbook of D2C, now it is more costly than ever to drive retention.*

Rise of Brands 2.0 redefined engagement economy, yet it was still unscalable:

**1. Connected | Customers → Followers**

Increased use of social media connected local nodes of brand communities to one another, creating global connectedness to contrast brands. Customers got overwhelmed by top-down content resulting in disinterested views of advertising.

*Customers shifted into followers who could react but not act.*

**2. Interactive** (**Comment & Influence) | Customers positioned themselves as experts.**

Brands 2.0 created the participation to comment, and react on brand experience. This gave rise to one-in-a-million users becoming influencer for the brand by creating user-generated content. Influencers became the ambassadors pushing the brand narrative.

> *Influencers were the first proof of concept of the need for community input and contribution back to the brand. Yet, the influencer’s fame was the proof of work within that social network dictated by centralized algorithms, and this proof of work is not always aligned with the brand’s needs.* 
>
> *Same influencers started promoting many brands, repeating one-to-many marketing.*

**3. Direct-to-Consumer Engagement | Brands following the D2C playbook**

Brands have exhausted attention and consumption economy. Now, all brands are blending in, executing the same D2C and products are taking ownership of the community, and data.

### State of Brands 2.0

*Existing Web 2.0 take the ownership of the community away from the brand–– they are at best, saturated and, at worst, actively deteriorating.*

![Customers consuming top-down, standardized content. Facade of engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WdAaMQ9AlkpomFP4GVy2u.png?height=421&width=750)

**It has never been more expensive to acquire customers, and fans or challenging to retain them.**  *D2C acquisition costs skyrocketed by 60% over the last decade (with competition on ads, saturation in market, and declining effectiveness of Facebook “look alike audiences” following Apple’s App Tracking Transparency IOS 14 update)***. Thus, It has never been more important to incentivize customers.**

Now, there is a pressing need for brands to bypass the platform-centric marketing world of web2 and reclaim ownership of their digital consumer relationships to beat numbers in retention and lifetime value (LTV).

### Brands 3.0 — Own | Turning Customers into Owners (C⟷B)

With crypto, it is now possible to create the new engagement economy infrastructure **that powers the social and financial stake in a brand as a tool to drive followers and customers to become contributors to brands they use in deeper ways.**

> *Brands 3.0 refers to an infrastructure where instead of the brand being written and controlled by only a small group of experts, it is developed and shaped in full view of everyone, encouraging maximum participation — turning customers into co-creators, and stakeholders.*

![Poolsuite Tiered NFT-Membership Cards created effective and scalable engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q6Gki0OrsjQjNv2zc01EJ.png?height=1402&width=2872)

These inputs do not necessarily give full ownership to the community but create bottom-up channels to harness value and contribution from community members.

In status quo, customers cannot differentiate between brands as followers anymore. They harness deep untapped insights and emotions for brands that if scalably harnessed, can help bring universal data to unlock brands’ next engagement steps.

> In Brands 3.0, consumers  are powered to contribute back to brands by giving feedback, insights, co-creating experiences, events, derivatives, and many more…. essentially *“building on top of the brand”* through configurable bounties.

1. **Unlocking True Loyalty | Proof of Engagement.**

In Brands 3.0, proof of engagement is the blood, tear, and work to get the status. It is the new proof of work by competing on quests and tiering up for reputation, exclusivity, and access to earn one’s standing in the ecosystem.

> Instead of pushing customers’ purchase notifications, Brands 3.0 creates sustainable and authentic loyalty by aligning customers’ incentives to earn brand reputation and access.

***Building the Engagement Economy Infrastructure Powering New Era of Brands***

For a brand, a strong reputation and community are hard to build and easy to destroy.  [There are over 30,000 new products introduced every year, and ](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[95 percent](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.)**[ fail](https://www.inc.com/marc-emmer/95-percent-of-new-products-fail-here-are-6-steps-to-make-sure-yours-dont.html#:\~:text=According%20to%20Harvard%20Business%20School,year%2C%20and%2095%20percent%20fail.) –– falling out of relevance.

### ***Community ⟷ Brand Symbiosis***

***A similar pattern to how the web has evolved over time can be seen in brands****. Since brands are catching up by integrating web evolution, we can extrapolate the past and present to define the future of what Brands 3.0 will look like.*

### Brands 1.0 — Read Only | Post-Industrialization Prescriptive Branding

![Buy this brand...Because it is better, purer &  stronger than all others. ok?](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PQH15GIS_rSBHq_a9TovN.png?height=378&width=694)

* **The earliest version of brands was prescriptive and dogmatic.** Top-down, read-only campaigns were used to *dictate* customers to believe pre-conceived slogans that advertised brand could bring happiness and perform better.
* **Brands 1.0 was the “read-only” web – a brand that was rigid, utility-focused, and not interactive in any significant sense.** Early branding and advertising were one-to-many. Mass-produced interactions through radio, newspapers, tv, and banners with no controls and forms to engage back for the customers.
* Since top bottlenecks were still mass production and global distribution, customer needs, values and relevance were secondary, thus not important.
* **Brands 1.0 was the first status and community formation based on one’s neighborhood.** Buyers were not able to globally engage, but the first form of communities around brands was formed where logos and packaging were used as the first symbols of community.

### Brands 2.0 — Read & Write | Rise of Interactivity, Social Connectivity, and User-Generated Content

*Web2.0 eliminated the cost to build a brand, powering the formation of micro-brands and customer networks as communities. However, with the standardized, top-down playbook of D2C, now it is more costly than ever to drive retention.*

![Bucket of D2C brands out of ocean of others executing the same engagement playbook](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VOuByBWwhnufg4SwswYCm.png?height=592&width=1280)

Brands 2.0 describes the current state of the brand engagement economy, which gave more content and usability for end-users compared to the earlier one-to-many brand incarnation.

> *Brands 2.0 also refers to the shift in the definition of “brand”. Instead of only products or corporations, any experience, service, creator, and product that have carved out its own niche and community in an increasingly overcrowded market became a brand.*

Rise of Brands 2.0 redefined engagement economy, yet it was still unscalable:

**1. Connected | Customers → Followers**

Increased use of social media connected local nodes of brand communities to one another, creating global connectedness to contrast brands. Customers got overwhelmed by top-down content resulting in disinterested views of advertising.

*Customers shifted into followers who could react but not act.*

**2. Interactive** (**Comment & Influence) | Customers positioned themselves as experts.**

Brands 2.0 created the participation to comment, and react on brand experience. This gave rise to one-in-a-million users becoming influencer for the brand by creating user-generated content. Influencers became the ambassadors pushing the brand narrative.

> *Influencers were the first proof of concept of the need for community input and contribution back to the brand. Yet, the influencer’s fame was the proof of work within that social network dictated by centralized algorithms, and this proof of work is not always aligned with the brand’s needs.* 
>
> *Same influencers started promoting many brands, repeating one-to-many marketing.*

**3. Direct-to-Consumer Engagement | Brands following the D2C playbook**

Brands have exhausted attention and consumption economy. Now, all brands are blending in, executing the same D2C and products are taking ownership of the community, and data.

### State of Brands 2.0

*Existing Web 2.0 take the ownership of the community away from the brand–– they are at best, saturated and, at worst, actively deteriorating.*

![Customers consuming top-down, standardized content. Facade of engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WdAaMQ9AlkpomFP4GVy2u.png?height=421&width=750)

**It has never been more expensive to acquire customers, and fans or challenging to retain them.**  *D2C acquisition costs skyrocketed by 60% over the last decade (with competition on ads, saturation in market, and declining effectiveness of Facebook “look alike audiences” following Apple’s App Tracking Transparency IOS 14 update)***. Thus, It has never been more important to incentivize customers.**

Now, there is a pressing need for brands to bypass the platform-centric marketing world of web2 and reclaim ownership of their digital consumer relationships to beat numbers in retention and lifetime value (LTV).

### Brands 3.0 — Own | Turning Customers into Owners (C⟷B)

With crypto, it is now possible to create the new engagement economy infrastructure **that powers the social and financial stake in a brand as a tool to drive followers and customers to become contributors to brands they use in deeper ways.**

> *Brands 3.0 refers to an infrastructure where instead of the brand being written and controlled by only a small group of experts, it is developed and shaped in full view of everyone, encouraging maximum participation — turning customers into co-creators, and stakeholders.*

![Poolsuite Tiered NFT-Membership Cards created effective and scalable engagement](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q6Gki0OrsjQjNv2zc01EJ.png?height=1402&width=2872)

*From [building communities with DAOs like Friends With Benefits](https://www.fwb.help/) to building scalable utility, access, and status [in a brand-membership experience like Poolsuite](https://members.poolsuite.net/), past year’s web3 brand-building showcased the proof of concept for Brands 3.0.*

**Brands 3.0 core primitives that will transform how we interact and form brands:**

1. **Staying Relevant | Dynamic Product-Market Fit.**

By decentralizing taste, curation, and incentivizing giving quality insights and feedback, brands can create dynamic product-market fit and stay relevant through decades. These inputs do not necessarily give full ownership to the community but create bottom-up channels to harness value and contribution from community members.

**2. Unlocking Maximum Retention and Life Time Value | Contribute-to-earn.**

In status quo, customers cannot differentiate between brands as followers anymore. They harness deep untapped insights and emotions for brands that if scalably harnessed, can help bring universal data to unlock brands’ next engagement steps.

> In Brands 3.0, consumers  are powered to contribute back to brands by giving feedback, insights, co-creating experiences, events, derivatives, and many more…. essentially *“building on top of the brand”* through configurable bounties.

1. **Unlocking True Loyalty | Proof of Engagement.**

In Brands 3.0, proof of engagement is the blood, tear, and work to get the status. It is the new proof of work by competing on quests and tiering up for reputation, exclusivity, and access to earn one’s standing in the ecosystem.

> Instead of pushing customers’ purchase notifications, Brands 3.0 creates sustainable and authentic loyalty by aligning customers’ incentives to earn brand reputation and access.

***Building the Engagement Economy Infrastructure Powering New Era of Brands***

![Inter-connected, Incentivized Hyperstructures](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1nUDDSIB131DAd9XXe0GD.png?height=465&width=940)

Now, the opportunity is to design accessible products and protocols for 

***Brands 3.0  –*** 

***The new layer of brand engagement economy that will bootstrap acquisition and retention through better economic and social alignments:***

* *One that would scale into bringing life to brands with dynamic insights, engagement, and loyalty based on social reputation and financial incentives.*
* *One that outlasts purchase-indexed retention marketing, e-commerce, or chief marketing officers.*
* *One that turns customers into owners.*

Thank you to [Marty](https://twitter.com/marty), [Jaclyn Chan](https://twitter.com/straightupjac) , [Andreas Larsen](https://twitter.com/ndreaslarsen), [Alex Masmej](https://twitter.com/AlexMasmej), and many more for early conversations about future of brand engagement economy :)


---

*If these ideas excite you and you want to build together or exchange ideas,  [dm me at @0xGokce]() -* 

*and checkout [kalder](https://twitter.com/home) – We’re building web3-powered engagement tools for brands to define brands 3.0 frontier, [say hi](https://www.kalder.app/).*

And for all those who want to be early adopters, co-creators, or inspirators of this idea *––  I’’ll make this a collectible carrying through ownership & engagement economy ;)*

项目简介：

Carv 是一个去中心化自治组织 (DAO)，其使命是建立一个用户拥有的游戏身份，以实现成就展示、朋友和游戏发现、直接货币化，并且可以带到任何地方。

Carv 是一个免费的生态系统，包括 一个协议，一个Web3 游戏凭证的平台 展示和学术，INO，一个用于去中心化决策、国库保护和包容性增长刺激的 DAO ，以及一个用于扩展和聚会的社区！

“Carv 协议”的好处如下：

将所有这些信息集中在一个地方，用户可以清楚地查看他们在 Web3 游戏中的成就和足迹，并在整个游戏中解锁凭证门控福利。此外，凭证仪表板将被连接 通过中间件插件连接到其他 Web2 或 Web3 社交空间，允许用户使用他们的凭据进行社交。
游戏开发者可以利用“Carv 协议”的成就 API 为玩家设计成长路径，并通过 NFT 徽章奖励他们以更好地留存。 借助“Carv 协议”，他们还能够针对更有价值的用户而非投机用户参与 INO 和活动，并最终发展出更具可持续性的社区。
最终对于公会来说，他们可以根据过去在不同公会的不同游戏中的表现来选择学者，这增加了选择过程的准确性和公平性。此外，凭借其累积表现的确凿证据，玩家将推动自己建立他们可以随身携带的最佳“简历”，并在游戏中获得额外津贴。与此同时，公会最大化他们的利润。

title: 如何撼动Opensea? 一文汇总NFT交易平台「竞争策略大全」
body:
`文 | 0xC7 2022.7.13`

**前言**

2021 年，作为全球最大的交易市场 Opensea，其 1 年的交易量就达到了 140 亿美元，远远超过其 2020 年 2170 万美元的业绩，若根据 2% 的交易手续费来计算，在 2021 年创造的利润就高达 2.8 亿，这巨额的利润引发大家对 NFT 交易市场的关注。

![数据来源：https://tokenterminal.com/terminal](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U0VvIQZQkwR5ZITOKSTWO.png?height=928&width=1080)

在 2022 年，就出现了如 LooksRare 、X2Y2 这类的竞争者，就连全球交易量最大的去中心化交易所 —— Uniswap 也宣布收购 NFT 聚合器 Genie，向 Opensea 这位垄断者发起挑战。

这篇文章，主要分析目前各大 NFT 市场的对 Opensea 的竞争策略，供大家参考。

**一、LooksRare**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QHHro8lwikiX9FHbaChSs.png?height=530&width=1080)

LooksRare（以下） 是在 2022 年 1 月 11 日上线的 NFT 市场，上线至今已有半年，这半年期间，LR 通过多种策略对 Opensea 进行吸血攻击，

**1、对 Opensea 用户进行空投**

LooksRare 在上线之初便推出了协议代币——LOOKS，与其他协议不同，LooksRare 将协议收入 100% 分享给社区，用户可通过质押 LOOKS 代币来获得在 LooksRare 平台产生的交易手续费。

而在上线之初，LooksRare 采对 Opensea 的用户（交易量超过 3 ETH）进行空投，且对用户领取空投设置条件：需要挂一个 NFT 到 LooksRare 上售卖（简称挂单），这给 LooksRare 带来了第一批精准的种子用户。 
 

**2、交易挖矿**

为了吸引用户来平台交易，LooksRare 推出「交易挖矿」模式，即用户来Looksrare 交易后，买家跟卖家都会获得 LOOKS 代币奖励，以激励用户前往 LooksRare 进行交易，这个模式上线之初便备受争议，因为这种模式会给平台带来刷量虚假交易，然而我们从数据上来看，这种模式还是起一定效果，尤其是对 BAYC 这类的蓝筹 NFT 持有者有很大的吸引力，而其中大部分真实交易量都是由蓝筹 NFT 贡献。

**3、战略销售**

在平台上线之前，LooksRare 团队通过战略销售向早期投资人募集资金，而早期投资人中有很大一批是 NFT 领域相关的 KOL，这对 LooksRare 的品牌宣传上起到了相当大的作用，也让 LooksRare 在短期内（尤其是海外市场）拥有一定的人气。

**4、质押挖矿**

在该平台推出的第四个月，LookRare 便推出「挂单挖矿」，即通过 LOOKS 代币激励用户前往 LooksRare 进行挂单，来增加 NFT 的深度；另外在「质押挖矿」+「交易挖矿」的双重激励下，使得一些蓝筹 NFT 出现套利机会，也给 LooksRare 平台带来了一定的交易量。但质押挖矿只针对交易量排名量靠前的NFT，这对蓝筹 NFT 会有吸引作用。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l_RB5TA-APAKDCyrP1eI2.png?height=1048&width=1080)

总体来讲，LooksRare 对于 Opensea 的吸血攻击，短期来看还是有效果的。从数据上来看，除去刷量（0版税）部分，其真实交易量曾达到了 Opensea 的 28%，目前维持在 5% 左右。

![剔除0版税后的交易量 来源：https://dune.com/mhonkasalo/LooksRare-vs.-OpenSea](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GUUCcFBfhUlHW8HkRTTd_.png?height=298&width=1080)

而随着 LOOKS 代币价格的下跌，无论是交易还是挂单奖励奖励，对用户的吸引力也越来越小。**另外由于刷量交易的存在，虽然能给平台带来手续费，维持代币质押的高收益，但这也使得正常交易的用户获得的奖励下降了，从而挤走一部分正常交易的用户，长远来看，对平台是极其不利的**。

**二、X2Y2**

![来源：x2y2官网](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AHS5y0Kpu5UtsXRSBNB7d.png?height=377&width=1080)

在 LooksRare 对 Opensea 发起吸血攻击一个月后，X2Y2 发布第一版白皮书，在白皮书中指出 Opensea的问题，同时指出 LooksRare 交易挖矿带来的刷量问题，最后提出自己的解决方案，随后借势推出自己的 NFT 市场——X2Y2。

X2Y2 上线之初，也采取了对 Opensea 用户进行空投的方式，以此来吸引第一批种子用户，而后通过挂单奖励、低手续费等方式与 Opensea、Looksrare 展开竞争。

**1、0 交易手续费**

早期，X2Y2 通过免除用户的交易手续费的方式吸引了用户前往 X2Y2 上进行交易，而后 X2Y2 将平台手续费提升至0.5%，但也低于Opensea 2.5%、LooksRare 2%的交易手续费，对卖家来讲，可以以较低的交易佣金完成交易，对用户尤其是卖家还是有一定的吸引力。 
 

**2、挂单奖励**

从时间上来看，X2Y2 是第一个推出「挂单挖矿」的策略，吸引用户前来 X2Y2 挂单，以此来增加市场深度，但由于奖励机制并未设计好，且并未对 NFT 的范围进行限制，导致引来了一批羊毛党，最后因为效果不佳于 4 月 1 日取消了挂单挖矿。

**3、Gas 补贴+交易挖矿**

在取消挂单交易后，X2Y2 推出了为期一个月的 Gas 补贴，在 4 月 1 号到 4 月 30 号期间，在 X2Y2 上所有的 NFT 交易免手续费，并对用户花费的 Gas 费用 X2Y2 代币奖励进行补贴（每天 62 万个 X2Y2 代币），以此吸引用户前来交易。

而后在 5 月份，便推出交易奖励，但与 LooksRare 奖励机制上略不同，X2Y2 把更多的奖励分配给卖家而非买家。

![来源：x2y2官网](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/clK1VODCkTPLJu1KEEDOr.png?height=490&width=1080)

**即使如此，但这依旧避免不了刷量的问题。从数据上看，X2Y2在推出后，其用户数跟交易量都有所上涨，甚至一度超过Opensea，但通过 Dune 数据发现，除了交易量存在刷量的情况下，因为其 GAS 费用的补贴+交易奖励的补贴下，其成交量和用户数也存在刷量情况，从而营造出平台交易数据起来的假象。**

![X2Y2用户地址 NFT成交量与成交额排名 来源：https://dune.com/queries/803525/1421206](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_h3qMOqoW5aRsotPHqFd_.png?height=215&width=1080)

 
 **4、ILO+创世 NFT**

与 LooksRare 战略募资不同，X2Y2 则采取更加公平透明的 ILO方式想普通用户进行募资，而后 X2Y2 将 ILO 募集到的 ETH 与 X2Y2 组成 LP 而后将其私钥进行销毁，早期参与 ILO 的用户，也可以获得 X2Y2 的创世NFT。

![来源：x2y2官网](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sNGVyfYR8G7r-0ipFsvpO.png?height=562&width=1080)

这种策略对于早期平台来讲，能在短时间内赢得用户对平台的信任，并深度与平台进行绑定。

目前来看，X2Y2 这种策略还是有一定效果的，由于利益上的绑定，能让用户自发的组织起来去各大社交宣传 X2Y2，我们发现，只要推特上有关 Opensea、LooksRare 的话题，就会有 X2Y2 的宣传，从而达到病毒营销的效果。

![来源：某海外大 V 推特下的评论](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6wEr3oPG80biR3tlKvQs4.png?height=614&width=597)

目前由于其代币奖励机制过于复杂，没办法统计其真实的交易量和用户量，总体来看，目前 X2Y2 目前主要还是依靠低交易手续费+代币激励的方式来跟Opensea 进行竞争，这种策略能否持久，还有待验证。

## Opensea 的反击

目前从数据上来看，无论是 LooksRare 还是 X2Y2，依靠代币激励的方式，依旧没办法撼动 Opensea 龙头的地位，但 Opensea 似乎也察觉到威胁，并通过推出了一系列动作来应对。 
 

**1、收购 Gem 聚合器**

![Gem 聚合器界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/23os4oTuuU4CaG6kMoG-j.png?height=566&width=1080)

2022 年 4 月25日，OpenSea 官方发推宣布收购了NFT交易聚合器 Gem，Gem 是目前最大的NFT 聚合器， 集合了多个平台 (其中包括 OpenSea、Rarible、LooksRare、X2Y2、NFTX 和 NFT20) 上的 NFT 挂单，用户可通过 Gem 批量购买这些平台上的 NFT，这极大的提高了用户的便利性。

我们从数据上来看，无论是 LooksRare 还是 X2Y2，有很大一部分流量则是来自 Gem 聚合器，虽然 Gem 宣称会被收购后还继续保持独立运营，但无疑对后来竞争者来讲是一次巨大的威胁。 
 

**2、发布 Seaport 协议**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oFxM-Q2yi6h3LkFsyunCM.png?height=568&width=625)

2022年5月21日， OpenSea 刚刚推出了一个新的NFT市场协议 Seaport，并开源供大家使用，不久之后，Opensea便升级至 Seaport。

**Seaport 在功能上提供了多样化的交易方式**，比如售卖者可提供ETH、ERC20、ERC721 和 ERC1155 在内的 NFT 进行出价。举个例子，当用户拥有1个价值40 ETH的Doodle NFT，但想交易 1 个价值 100 ETH 的 BAYC NFT 时，就可用将拥有的Doodle NFT 和 60 ETH 来组合出价；用户可用 1 个BAYC 兑换包含CryptoPunk、Cryptoadz和Uniswap的 UNI 代币的捆绑包等。

**另一方面，Seaport 协议为用户提供 SudoSwap 工具**，让用户可以通过物换物的方式进行交易。比如通过 3 个 Doodle NFT 换取 1 个 BAYC NFT。

目前 Seaport 核心智能合约是开源的，本质上是去中心化的，没有合约所有者、具有可升级性以及其他特性。任何开发者都可以通过 Seaport 来构建自己的 NFT 交易市场，Opensea 通过这种方式能否帮助 Opensea 稳固在 NFT 行业的地位，也有待观察。

**四、Uniswap** 

近期，Uniswap Labs 宣布收购 NFT 市场聚合器 Genie 并向Genie的历史用户空投USDC，其实，在Uniswap V3 推出的时候，就能看出 Uniswap 进军 NFT的影子。

在 2021 年，Uniswap 正式发文介绍 Uniswap V3 版本。在 V3 版本中，流动性提供者质押的流动性代币由 NFT 来表示，这开创了由现实世界资产支持的 NFT先河。

![Uniswap V3 界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RhB1ZHeD8v7xFKOUF8mMR.png?height=848&width=862)

![Uniswap NFTs 界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Qlq93XQYo-IpYpBYO2gYf.png?height=615&width=1080)

另外，当 Uniswap 完成对 Genie 的集成后，利用 Uniswap 的优势，用户可以用不同的代币支付购买 NFT，另外 Uniswap NFT产品负责人 Scott 发推透露，在未来会为一些蓝筹 NFT 提供高定制化的交易市场，以提升用户的体验，但并未披露太多信息。

长期来看，无论是 LooksRare 还是 X2Y2，随着代币不断被稀释价格下跌的情况下，利用代币的激励的这种策略并无法有效撼动 Opensea 的地位。

尤其是交易奖励，两者都并未发挥出交易奖励的优势。

**交易奖励本质上跟烧钱补贴市场类似，拿当年网约车大战而言，各平台通过补贴司机用户来抢占市场份额，用户司机也的确在这轮大战中享受到了优惠，且这种收益是分散的。**

**但从目前结果来看，无论是 LooksRare 还是 X2Y2，交易奖励集中让少数几个刷单套利的人获得，这就挤走了大部分用户该享受到的利益，也并未能给平台带来有效的用户，虽然其代币质押者能捕捉到平台手续费，套利者能从刷单中获利，本质上是代币质押者通过代币价格补贴费用给套利者。**

站在这个角度来看，在这场游戏中，交易奖励对平台、平台代币持有者、用户都是不利的，唯一获利的只有那些刷单套利者，且对 Opensea 的威胁越来越小。

而 Uniswap 目前在以太坊上通过 DeFi 平台进行交易的 480 万个钱包中，有超过 400 万个钱包在 Uniswap 上进行了交易，比后来者 LooksRare、X2Y2 具有更多的用户基数，也可借助其品牌优势加上 Genie 聚合器对 Opensea 形成有效的冲击。

且对于 LooksRare、X2Y2 来讲， Uniswap 收购 Genie 反而是一件有利的事，不再担心 Opensea 收购 Gem 对自己平台的影响。在未来，LooksRare、X2Y2 可能更像是一个流动性提供商的角色，给 Uniswap NFT 提供更好的深度，以此来对抗 Opensea 的垄断。

**所以比起 LooksRare、X2Y2 吸血攻击，Uniswap 收购 Genie 聚合器这个动作对 Opensea 来讲更具威胁性。这让 Opensea 开始警惕，而收购 Gem、推出 Seaport 协议这一系列动作更像是对 Uniswap 收购 Gem 的回应。**

title: 如何在 Phaver discord 中拿到双角色（博取未来空投）

title: Dr. Campbell Harvey - DeFi and the Future of Finance
body:
Dr. Campbell Harvey is a Professor at Duke University where he teaches *Innovation and Cryptoventures.* He also teaches [Decentralized Finance (DeFi): The Future of Finance](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke) on Coursera.

He is the author of the book [Defi and the Future of Finance](https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3), to which Vitalik Buterin wrote the Preface and Fred Ehrsam the Foreward.

He has published papers on finance, crypto, and beyond. His most recent, [An Investor’s Guide to Crypto](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576), is available on SSRN, published June 2022.

\*\*Collect and own this episode as an NFT. Click “Collect” (top right corner). 0.01 ETH mint, limited collection of 111 NFTs.

**Listen to the podcast on Spotify or Apple:**

[https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dr-campbell-harvey-defi-and-the-future-of-finance/id1626927963?i=1000569243760](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dr-campbell-harvey-defi-and-the-future-of-finance/id1626927963?i=1000569243760)

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/7xI6KHIoZCQIekC8S14WEO?si=2SrWFPjwSUCEaqtV_-4VzQ](https://open.spotify.com/episode/7xI6KHIoZCQIekC8S14WEO?si=2SrWFPjwSUCEaqtV_-4VzQ)

I highly recommend checking out Dr. Campbell Harvey’s course, book, and paper, linked below.

**Decentralized Finance, via Coursera:**

[https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke)

**DeFi and the Future of Finance, the book.**

I read the book and specifically enjoyed the coverage of many concepts we often hear about, yet might not have as good of a true understanding as we’d like (burn, mint, bonding curve, consensus mechanisms, portability, oracles, and more).

I also enjoyed learning about five of the biggest problems within centralized finance, which DeFi can help solve. The implications in solving these problems are huge - for both equality of opportunity as well as economic growth.

[https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3](https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3)

**An Investor’s Guide to Crypto, published on SSRN:** in the show, he mentions footnote 4, which includes selected projects from 20 different areas in the blockchain space, such as layer 1, layer 2, defi, privacy, NFTs, gaming, metaverse, social networks, identity, bridges, etc.

[https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576)

**Show Notes, Key Takeaways:**

* “We’re right at the beginning of this disruption”.
* On Satoshi Nakamoto’s 2008 Bitcoin Whitepaper: “Its the sort of paper that potentially changes the way things work in the world.”
* A statement made by a student who took his [course](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke): “Over the past couple of years I’m in so many conversations where people are talking about crypto, and I was just a wallflower. But after your course, I’m in the mix. I can ask questions, and I can ask good questions.”
* “Being able to see-through the incorrect and mistaken statements that we so often hear is important.”
* “What you should look at is not the price of the crypto, but the interests of the venture capitalists. And they love it right now.”
* “We need to look beyond the price movement, and figure out what problems exist, and figure out if the technology can solve the problem, while maintaining a realistic time-frame.”
* “You don’t need a degree in computer science. What you need is to be creative - to identify problems that could be solved with this space, and just jump in.”

**Intros:**

Dr. Campbell Harvey has been in the space since 2013. He was formerly editor of Journal of Finance.

When he got back into teaching the international finance course he thought it would be valuable to add a section on bitcoin.

He read the Satoshi white paper, and realized it was a foundational idea.

It was a vary niche idea in 2013.

He was surprised it was not published in one of the top journals – it was the type of paper that every academic strives to have. “Its the sort of paper that potentially changes the way things work in the world.”

**Creating a course on crypto at Duke**

Decides to devote a lecture to cryptocurrency.

Enlists a colleague (who turned out to be an undergrad student) from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to help with preparing for the blockchain topics and cryptocurrency course.

The student, as a bitcoin developer, goes on to finish at Duke in 3 years, later joining startup in Silicon Valley. (The story as told in the episode is really worth a listen!)

Professor Harvey delivers his lecture on crypto and blockchain, and the students end up staying late after class, sharing the transformational impact that the lecture had.

That single lecture evolved into a course at Duke, as well as four courses on Coursera in Decentralized Finance. The book is based on the course.

Nowadays, he teaches less on traditional finance and more decentralized finance.

After taking his courses, one student expressed: “Over the past couple of years I’m in so many conversations where people are talking about crypto, and I was just a wallflower. But after your course, I’m in the mix. I can ask questions, and I can ask good questions…”

**Risk**

Half of the book is about risk.

You need to understand the risks. Finance is not only about expected returns, but about assessing the risks.

The material for *Innovation and Cryptoventures* changes so quickly -- every semester there is new material due to the fast paced nature of the crypto industry.

**Blockchain Conference assignment**

One semester, an assignment for the course was to attend a blockchain conference, and make note of false statement that so-called expert panelists say.

This assignment highlighted the importance of being able to determine if someone thinks they know something but they don’t really know.

Being able to see-through the incorrect and mistaken statements that we so often hear is important.

Co-authors of the book are former teaching assistants of the course.

“We’re right at the beginning of this disruption”

**Recent paper, *Investor’s Guide to Crypto* was published in June 2022 on SSRN.**

In traditional finance, if you don’t like the volatility, you can take a diversify between risky assets and stable assets. Similar principles can be applied to crypto.

Volatility should be expected in these markets.

It is a mistake to look at only bitcoin and ether.

See footnote 4 in the [paper](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576), which sketches 20 different areas in the blockchain space, such as layer 1, layer 2, defi, privacy, NFTs, gaming, metaverse, social networks, identity, bridges, etc.

The basic lessons of diversification should be taken into account.

There are a few sections on active strategies.

The paper also debunks a few valuation models - for example, coupling the valuation of bitcoin to the value of gold metal.

In 2019-2020, based on the number of Coinbase and Robinhood wallets, the number of speculators in the space increased.

**Risk-on vs. Risk-off investments**

* Risk-off assets: People buy safer assets like US Treasury Bonds.
* Risk-on assets: once we had a vaccine, people tended to get back into risky assets.
* Risk-on assets tend to be dumped during tumultuous times, such as March 2020 when COVID hit. The stock market dipped 35%, bitcoin dropped 55%.

**Custody:**

If you lose your private keys, you lose your crypto. This is a risk management challenge for people.

Fidelity and Coinbase Pro are entering into the custodial space. This increases the ability for institutional investors to enter the space.

**Regulatory:**

ETFs, however, have faced regulatory challenges.

Dr. Harvey has written twice to the SEC suggesting the approval of ETFs.

We don’t have a lot of regulatory guidance today. It is hilarious to think that crypto fits into the securities act of 1933. If you’re a security, you need a transfer agent, which is an algorithm in DeFi. Regulators don’t have an easy job.

If we impose regulations that are too harsh, then innovations go off-shore. If regulation is too lax, then people will be taken advantage of.

It is difficult to find a middle ground. It takes a lot of time.

We should have a safe harbor period.

**Broad potentials of blockchain**

1\.7 billion people in the world are unbanked.

In web3, your bank is your smartphone. No transferring money from banks - you simply link your wallet.

There is no web3 without decentralized finance. You can pay for stuff, but you can also be paid.

This technology offers the promise of making the economy much more efficient.

Bankers tend to prefer to deal with larger customers, and give larger customers the best deals.

Smaller projects are thus more difficult to start-up today with traditional financing.

If we can solve this problem, we can increase investment, increase growth, and real GDP.

We eventually need to pay down our debt - the answer is growth.

We can bump growth between 5-8%.

“What you should look at is not the price of the crypto, but the interests of the venture capitalists. And they love it right now”.

**Dapps and Web3 Wallets**

Dapps are different - whereas something like twitter is a centralized app, something like Metamask is opensource and you can see the code on Github.

You can’t do DeFi without a decentralized app.

**NFTs class:**

Professor Harvey teaches a lecture on NFTs.

Prices are likely to go down on digital art.

The class on NFTs focuses on applications of NFTs that will be important in the future.

The NFT monetization model seems to be much more beneficial to artists than for traditional model with galleries.

All students have a Metamask wallet.

Students in the class create NFTs. For example: [Campbell Harvey teaching how to create an NFT](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x495f947276749ce646f68ac8c248420045cb7b5e/50561657042432192467685888375638478561674832866731720087550735600749304086529)

There is a class token, and they get rewards for doing certain things, like asking good questions of suggesting a change in wording.

Students get a reward for visiting the Bitcoin and Ethereum mining operation at Duke. Students take a selfie in front of the miners, and post that selfie as an NFT as proof that they were there… Proof of Attendance.

**Use cases for NFTs:**

* Augmented Reality fashion - all the big fashion houses have NFT initiatives. At London Fashion week there was a half day on digital fashion.
  * Beyond this, the metaverse is a huge future application of NFTs.
* POAPs / certificates of completion, proof of attendance.
* Ticketing and artist / fan interaction. Fans could buy tickets, songs, or merch directly from the artist. An NFT from a show or concert could form a small community among fans. Direct interaction between community and artist.
* Identity: Eventually, you won’t need credit cards and debit cards - it could all be linked to the identity NFT.
  * University degrees, for example, would have to be non-transferrable. Its easy track on-chain if someone purchased a university degree or if it is counterfeit.

We need to look beyond the price movement, and figure out what problems exist, and figure out can the technology solve the problem, while maintaining a realistic time-frame.

**Web1, 2, and 3**

* Web1: a way to access information. Only a way to consume content.
* Web2: social. Creating community like Twitter, Facebook, etc.
* Web3: the ability to transfer value. People who designed the initial browsers thought we would have digital currency, but they failed. Blockchain solves the double spend problem and makes it possible.

**Crypto cycles and the internet bubble - we’re early**

Even during and after the crash of the internet bubble, the internet didn’t go away. The strong firms remain. We can expect similar situations across cryptocurrency bull-bear cycles.

There will be spectacular failures, and spectacular successes.

The key thing is that we’re early. And its always an advantage to be there at this point where it’s really early.

Traditional financial institutions will likely be doing much smaller things.

You need to be the disruptor, not the disrupted. This space offers a lot of potential to be the disruptor.

You don’t need a degree in computer science. What you need is to be creative - to identify problems that could be solved with this space, and just jump in.

title: 新版Axie Infinity能否焕发第二春？
body:
曾经的区块链游戏龙头Axie Infinity不复此前风光，在过去的几个月间，它接连陷入游戏通证暴跌、链上资产被盗等困境，日活跃用户由高峰时期的百万人降至数万人。

身处至暗时刻，Axie Infinity开发团队承认，游戏的热度衰退与通证经济模型设计缺陷以及可玩性不足有关。看到问题的Axie Infinity将如何改进？不久前，它正式发布了名为Origin的新版本游戏。这是一个有着全新界面、战斗机制、美术特效和故事情节的版本，承载着Axie Infinity重返高光的使命。

相比此前的游戏版本，Origin版本增强了策略玩法，玩家需使用牌组根据作战情况挑选卡牌进行对战；同时，新版本强调了免费属性，所有新玩家都可以免费领取3个初始Axies进行体验，以降低入场门槛；7月1日，Axie Infinity还上线了虚拟地块质押功能，当前有92%的虚拟地块处于质押状态。

根据CryptoSlam 7月12日的数据，过去一周里， Axie Infinity NFT的销售额比前7天增长了近198% ，达到138万美元。尽管这个数字相比其高峰期每周动辄上亿美元的销售额微不足道，但数字的增长意味着Axie Infinity的改版正在发挥效用。

按照规划，新版本的Axie Infinity在进行多个阶段的迭代后会开启正式赛季。该款游戏的定位也将随之改变，据其官方产品负责人Philip La透露，Axie Infinity将从一个「玩赚游戏」演变成一个「玩和赚游戏」。他的态度很明确 — — 希望用户在其中体会到游戏的乐趣，而不仅是为了赚钱。

> **Axie Infinity推出免费版降低入场门槛**

经历了加密市场的牛熊转换以及跨链桥被盗事故后，曾风靡一时的链游龙头Axie Infinity也跟着跌入了低谷。在去年8月的巅峰时期，Axie Infinity日活跃用户数曾高达100万以上，如今这一数字仅徘徊在数万人左右。

由高峰跌入谷底的Axie Infinity被一些业内人士认为将不可避免地走向衰败。这原本也符合游戏大行业的规律。不过，从近日的数据表现看，身处至暗时刻的Axie Infinity正焕发出一丝生机。

根据CryptoSlam 7月12日的数据，过去一周里， Axie Infinity NFT的销售额比前7天增长了近198% ，达到138万美元。尽管这个数字相比其高峰期动辄上亿美元的周销售额显得微不足道，但数字的增长意味着Axie Infinity正在走出低谷。

营收增加与该游戏迭代推出了「Axie Infinity：Origin」新版本有关，该版本主打「免费玩」以吸引新用户流量，同时推出了虚拟地块质押功能。

「Axie Infinity：Origin」目前支持通过Mavis Hub 下载客户端，测试版适配Android和iOS设备。从App看，这款游戏铺陈了全新的界面，战斗机制、美术特效和故事情节都有所改变。相比此前的游戏版本，新版本中Axie（小精灵）的统计数据不再与「健康、速度、技能和士气」等指标相关，所有的Axie都具有相同的基础生命值，同时也没有基于种类的优势和劣势。

Axie Infinity Origin版本游戏界面

Origin版本中，玩家主要使用卡牌进行对战，每名玩家派出3个小精灵，每个小精灵可以搭配符文并进行升级。在作战时，玩家将获得一个18张牌的牌组，每个回合可获得5张牌，每张牌都有不同的功能，最终玩家依靠出牌的策略以及小精灵的强度来取得胜利。

玩家可参与的对战模式也比此前增加了不少。新游戏版本中，分为冒险模式、排名赛以及锦标赛。其中冒险模式支持玩家自行闯关练习，排名赛则通过积分的形式统计排名，榜单靠前者可获得AXS通证奖励，锦标赛则会定期组织。

相比Axie Infinity Classical游戏版本，新版本强调了「免费」属性。所有「初学者」都可以在登陆游戏后免费获得3个初始Axie小精灵，随着冒险模式的升级，玩家还可以无偿解锁更多小精灵。这意味着，新玩家不必再充值加密资产购买小精灵才能进行游玩，这无疑降低了玩家的入场门槛。

当然，系统赠送的初始Axie也有一定局限性。初始Axie并不是NFT，不能交易或用于赚取SLP通证，其升级能力也较付费版的Axie弱一些。

这一改动吸引了许多新玩家前来。根据Axie Infinity官方公布的数据，自Origin版本发布以来，有超过60万个新增账户注册。

除了推出「免费玩」的版本外，Axie Infinity还于7月1日上线了虚拟地块质押玩法，该玩法允许游戏生态中的地块拥有者质押土地来获得AXS收入。根据Axie Infinity所在的Ronin区块链的浏览器数据，当前共有15330块地块处于质押状态，占据总量的92%。

> **Axie Infinity从「玩赚」走向「玩和赚」**

「Axie Infinity 正处于一个重要的过渡时期，因为我们在整个游戏中演变成一个更可持续的模型和叙事。」Axie Infinity背后开发商Sky Mavis的游戏产品负责人Philip La如此说道。

在过去的几个月间，Axie Infinity接连遭遇重创，市场中关于该游戏「不可持续」的声音愈发响亮。

一方面，随着加密资产熊市来临，以及游戏内两个主要通证AXS和SLP的不断增发，这两个作为玩家主要收入的资产大幅下跌。

根据CoinMarketCap的数据， AXS 目前的价格约为13美元，比去年11月创下的近 165 美元的峰值价格下跌了92%。与此同时，SLP价值为0.00367美元，相比 2021 年 7 月近0.4美元的峰值跌超99%。

通证价格下滑导致「打金」收入锐减，这是Axie Infinity用户大规模流失的主要原因。根据区块链分析公司Nansen今年3月发布的一份报告，在行情热度下降后，Axie Infinity的活跃用户从最高峰值下降了70%，Ronin链上Axie Infinity NFT的销量也回落至低位。

另一方面，今年3月，Ronin链连接以太坊的跨链桥遭遇了黑客攻击，共计损失价值 6.25 亿美元的加密资产。这一事故波及了大量的Axie Infinity玩家，游戏内的存款和取款也一度暂停。虽然后续Axie Infinity依赖Binance等平台的帮助，重新开放了取款通道，但不少玩家因为担心安全性问题从Ronin链撤出了资金。

这些接连发生的挑战，让处于困境中的Axie Infinity雪上加霜。据BeInCrypto Research数据显示，Axie Infinity 3月份销量暴跌8.16亿美元，销售额约为3100万美元，相比2月份下降了61%。反观过去一年，它创造了高达13亿美元的收入。

Axie Infinity官方后续也坦承，游戏内通证的经济模型设计存在问题，玩法上也有改进空间。而近期上线的Origin版本，便是该游戏在复盘改进后的一次重新出发，某种程度上承担了了Axie Infinity重返高光的使命。

准确地说，当前的Origin版本仍是一个雏形。根据Axie Infinity的开发规划，这个游戏版本还有四个更迭阶段，第一阶段是提升游戏内决策的数量，让游戏变得更有趣；第二阶段主要将重置游戏进度，并向排行榜前列玩家发放少量AXS奖励；第三阶段，游戏会增加 SLP 产出和消耗；最后，Axie Infinity才会开启第一个正式赛季。

当前，Axie Infinity已经进入了第二阶段，在社交媒体上，许多用户分享了他们在Axie Infinity的游玩经历，尽管当前游戏内提供的奖励并不多，但许多用户反映，新的卡牌对战机制，让这款游戏的可玩性大幅提高。「相比此前对战尤为依赖Axie精灵的属性和等级，现在的游戏更侧重策略比拼。」

在可玩性的塑造上更进一步，是Axie Infinity的一个重大目标，也意味着它的游戏定位转变。Philip La在最新博客中表示，Axie Infinity正在从一个「玩赚」游戏演变成一个「玩和赚」游戏。他的态度很明确 — — 希望用户在其中体会到游戏的乐趣，而不仅是为了赚钱。

据透露，未来Axie Infinity还会开发「土地不对称玩法」。即针对生态中拥有土地和未拥有土地的玩家，设计两套玩法机制，以让每一个角色都能积极参与并从中获得价值。

尽管如今的Axie Infinity仍较它的巅峰期相差甚远，但在Origin版本发布后，这款链上游戏终于止住数据全面下滑的颓势。7月7日，Sky Mavis 的联合创始人 Jeff Zirlin披露，在过去的 24 小时内已售出约2.2万个 Axies，比几周前24小时内售出的 7千个有所增加。

Axie Infinity近期销售数据有所回暖

面对外界对Axie Infinity的种种质疑，Philip La也颇有信心地回应称，这款游戏仍然存在，并定期推出重大改进，「我们将继续推出更多游戏，应用我们随着时间的推移所学到的所有知识。」

作为链游领域的王牌项目，Axie Infinity能否通过模式改变持续保持增长势头，也是业内关注的重点。值得注意的是，即使在熊市中，仍有许多区块链游戏处于开发进程中，随着新游戏陆续登陆市场，王牌也会面临竞争考验。
